Reviews.Title: “Perfect 3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: rlhardman
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with pleasant staff and in a great location for the sights of the city, especially Potsdammer Platz and the Topography of Terror. Berlin's public transport is amazing so despite the requirement of a few changes to get to the city from the airport it's very simple. Make sure you buy the week/72hr travel ticket, top value plus gets you discounts at attractions. Rooms are HUGE and comfy with everything you need, including dressing gowns, coffee machine and rubber duck! The partition between the bathroom and bedroom isn't very substantial so it's not that private ;) We didn't have breakfastowing the room so we went to the lovely cafe Stresseman just down the road. Would certainly stay with Movenpick again. And would definitely recommend the city of Berlin as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: paqu42
Reviews.Content: We looked for a nice hotel next to a bus stop of the famous line M29 (formerly 129). Indeed, the stop was very close - and all the rest was excellent as well. The breakfast buffet was great, and the service was very friendly without being intrusive. We definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Atmospheric hotel in convenient area.”
Reviews.Author: carshalton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a former Seimens factory which has been completely renovated with a few artefacts remaining.We only had our breakfast there which was superb as it is a few minutes walk to the restaurant area near Potsdamer Platz,The room was very quiet once we had managed to turn off the airconditioning which was very noisy.We asked for extra pillows and tea making facilities which arrived.The concierge was very helpful and sorted us out for a bus tour and a boat ride.We used the bar which was convenient.It is not open on Sunday but drinks can be purchased in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: riopoker
Reviews.Content: I just want to thank Mövenpick Hotel Berlin for their amazing service, great attitude and wonderful atmosphere. We were their guests for three days and it was a brilliant experience. I will always recommend Mövenpick Hotel as the best one in the centre of Berlin. I hope to see them again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: biggersn
Reviews.Content: The rooms were modern and comfortable, the bar was good and the location (within easy walking distance to Potsdamer Platz, the Tiergarten and the Brandenburg Gate) was brilliant. My only quibble is that breakfast was not included - on the first morning we had a simple breakfast at the hotel (as we arrived at 6am before our room was reading) and it was rather on the expensive side. We chose a nearby cafe for breakfast for the rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DarrelExmoor
Reviews.Content: Very happy that we picked this hotel for our stay in Berlin. The friendly and helpfull staff tended to the few queries we had very quickly, while the room was everything we could have hoped for. The subway station is only 50m away, which gives easy assess to all parts of Berlin, and by buying the day tickets we could explore at minimal cost. My advice to visitors would be, do not miss "The Topographie of Terror" exhibition, which while not an easy study gives full background to horror of the third reich.

Reviews.Title: “As Expected”
Reviews.Author: Ashraf2012
Reviews.Content: Booked De Luxe room , all faclities were as expected from Movenpick. The size of the wardrope is a joke it can bearly take my clothes and it also acommodate the safe deposit box and the Mini Bar. Overall it was comfort and adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: morgan88
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, comfortable beds, great food and a great location. Upon checking in, we were offered either a room upgrade or free breakfast. We chose the breakfast and it was outstanding. Many choices, very fresh and healthy. We loved this hotel and will stay here again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Best bathroom ever! (though not if you're shy...)”
Reviews.Author: Angiewoodles
Reviews.Content: We had a superior room and, in fairness, we got a good deal, so perhaps would have reviewed this place more harshly had we paid the full price. We got a deal through a coupon site, with an upgrade to a superior room if available on the day (I had no idea such a thing existed, but apparently it does and we were upgraded). The room was nice, but it's the bathroom that was the real winner. Very deep bath, so nice I was having two baths a day! Perfect after a long day of pounding the Berlin pavement! Much of the bathroom wall is made from glass bricks, so not entirely opaque. Not ideal if your sharing with friends, but as long as your friend agrees not to go along the side of the bathroom (there is only a desk there) then it's all rosy even if you are a bit on the shy side! The bar seemed to have a bizarre 80's throwback feel, not sure if that was deliberate.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best service I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: kiwiboyLondon
Reviews.Content: While here for work I had the pleasure to get some of the best customer service I have ever experienced in a hotel. The staff were friendly, helpful and professional at all times. The rooms themselves are also very trendy and the rest of the hotel is very well maintained. Would totally recommend to anyone wanting a warm welcome to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Thomas S
Reviews.Content: excellent stay, services, nice staff, very good location in walking ditance to the new modern centre of the city - and actually fropm there even to the old town... I especially liked the architecture of this hotel new and old in symbiosis - very good!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikecoxon
Reviews.Content: Got an excellent deal on two nights at Movenpick via a popular deals website. The rooms are large and clean (we were upgraded to a Superior which was nice) and the hotel in itself is nicely decorated. The area around the hotel is a bit grim however it's very near to popular tourist sites such as Checkpoint Charlie and Potsdamer Platz, plus you've got the u-bahn on your doorstep. The staff were friendly but not very knowledgeable. We got told different things by different members of staff when asking about check out and public transport which made things difficult. The breakfast is very good and the bar pleasant enough. The hotel was very quiet (both in terms of noise and the number of guests) but for a couple of nights stay it more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “i love berlin”
Reviews.Author: alelove3
Reviews.Content: nice hotel in berlin!!! so when u get in u find a smile behind the desk!!! room are very clean and no noise. international tv very good breakfast and also u have room meeting and sauna and gim also u have american bar with a funny guy!!! just in front of u the tube station so in july i ll be back in berlin...so hope to find a free room there again enjoy your trip alex

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: hopsie2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nites for a weekend getaway and we were really impressed. Staff were very friendly and warm, room was very lovely and extremely clean. Breakfast was awesome - great food and you are spoilt for choice. Close to tube station and to the center of town.Couldnt ask for more. If we ever have to come back to berlin we will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Upper basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Giulia_London
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for more than a week in December for a business trip. The hotel is generally clean. The stuff polite but not too helpful. The room was good size, but not enough storage space and I don't expect too much of it anyway; quiet one, facing internal courtyard, which on the downside meant not too much light. Room service was also decent, but nothing special. All in all an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location, reasonable price, very helpful and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: twz1
Reviews.Content: spent 3 nights there in a business trip just before xmass, but with my wife who is interested in the berlin monuments. as such, i believe it was an excellent and budget-wise choice: the interior is nice, rooms well design-like equipped, and - especially - the staff is extremely attentive but not intrusive which is making the stay a very pleasant experience. location is just brilliant - walking distance to potstdammer, musem insel, topografie des terrors, etc. breakfast and internet are overpriced (i never understood why in germany, wifi in rooms is not part of the service), but there is plenty places around where you can eat cheap and connect for free. for a dinner, the choice and quality of meals in the hotel restaurant is what you would expect - not cheap, but very tasty. highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel I come back to”
Reviews.Author: Tiger751023
Reviews.Content: Hi, I have stayed at this hotel quite a few time for work, and also privately over weekend. We even booked our conference here, so I know my opinion reflect 25 other as well. The hotel is clean, and the rooms are great, and whole. The meeting rooms where best so far (survey confirmed it completely) . Breakfast and food is also very good, but a bit to go to excellent. Network connections was the main pain item. It is expensive and does not really work that well. For my own impression: Location is great. I sometimes get annoyed that they don't fry the bacon properly, but then again it is till better then average. The staff is always very friendly, but sometimes the will is a bit higher then the ability. Great evening cocktails after a hard day at work.

Reviews.Title: “History, style, comfort, service”
Reviews.Author: HrundiVB
Reviews.Content: My favourite hotel in Berlin that I have been faithful to since my first visit sometime in 2005. On a couple of recent trips to Berlin I was booked into hotels other than the Movenpick that had more stars but definitely less soul and they just made me want to return to the Movenpick. I originally chose Movenpick for history: located in a well preserved industrial building where modern amenities have been successfully integrated into an old brick factory, complete with pieces of machinery thrown about. Then I realised how laid back, discreet, comfortable and convenient it was and kept returning ever since. I love the design, the mix of old building with very modern yet not aggressive furniture and styling. It is in a great location: historical yet central, buiness yet both lively and quiet, with convenient connections and lots of history all around. There are Berlin hotels with bigger rooms, better prices, more centrally located, with more staff... but Movenpick still comes out as a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Moevenpick Berlin - An Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: dannysixpack
Reviews.Content: The moevnpick Amsterdam is one of my favorite hotels to stay at, so when i went to berlin, it seemed the obvious choice. While berlin is not exactly a walking city, the movenpick is in an excellent location walking distance from a lot of great places. I walked to checkpoint charlie, The topography of terror museum (ss headquarters), museum island and many others. The moevenpick is modern, clean and comfortable and has all the amenities. They have a GREAT breakfast, that while quite expensive, is almost worth the price. Quality-wise and choice-wise it is a good value. Desk staff was friendly and couldn't be more helpful. the ONLY thing i can nitpick about is the shower was missing a tiny little tile on the floor, and there was a little dirt in the corner of the shower. bedding/beds/everything else was as spotless and fresh as i am accustomed to at moevenpick.

Reviews.Title: “just reasonable”
Reviews.Author: swallow2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in the very center of the city but within easy reach to everywhere. Everything is reasonable there - rooms are quite spacious, breakfasts are very good, the staff is helpfull. The reception area is big but a littie bit gloomy. If you travel on business, it's a good choice. If it is for pleasure, something more cheeful could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Room was more charming than typical large hotels”
Reviews.Author: KCS
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one evening at the Movenpick and have some pro's and con's + The rooms are quite nicely set up and didn't feel sterile like many large hotels The building is old and charming Helpful staff The bar looked good, only stuck my head in though - No WIFI - expect this as a basic service in such hotels English TV channels were only news channels. Would like movies/drama TV like BBC 1 (or WIFI!) I could not get miles & more points due to the "rate" I was on which was probably a company rate. Normally I still can get hotel points in this case at other chains. No tea/coffee facilities and no bottle of water that is common these days There were not many or very good toilietries available. WIth the liquid restriction on flights I use the shampoo, soap, etc provided at the hotel and this hotel had a one bottle in the shower which was for everything and I don't think these are good. I prefer separate products for hair & body - allin1 is "cheap". No hair conditioner or cotton wool etc. Just the allin1 & cheap body lotion.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious hotel with courteous and polite staff.”
Reviews.Author: Alistair M
Reviews.Content: Clean and spacious hotel. Rooms light and airy. En suite shower fantastic. On site gym and sauna but of limited use. Bar has a large selection of cocktails and beers. Breakfast a good varied choice. Only negative was the WiFi price, considering the price of the room would of expected a free limited option.

Reviews.Title: “"an okay stay"”
Reviews.Author: Janez K
Reviews.Content: Some friends gave me the advice for that hotel... Im not angry with them now, but still i expected a little bit more according to there referrals. Nothing to bad but if youre looking for a really comfortable stay in Berlin you should choose something else...

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: kam1700
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in October, 2011. The location is good (not excellent), but right beside an S-bahn station. Hotel itself was nicely furnished, clean, and very reasonable for nightly rates - restaurant there has a poor menu and is incredibly expensive. Wonderful meals can be had elsewhere within a 10 minute walking radius. Overall, though, enjoyed my stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely service - would use again”
Reviews.Author: CMC6970
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed in this hotel for about six months on and off. We also stayed there together as a family for several weekends. The service was consistently friendly, of an excellence standard and proactively helpful without being intrusive. The reception staff speak perfect English and didn't laugh when we tried to practice speaking German with them. The breakfasts are lavish and relaxed, served in a lovely dinner quadrangle where on summer days the glass roof retracts. We ate dinner there on a number of occasions and the food was very good but naturally at hotel prices 15 - 25 Euro for a main I seem to recall. They have quite a seasonal menu which is nice. The location was great, just about 5 minutes walk to the Sony Centre in Potsdamer Platz. Would be happy to recommend this to anyone visiting Berlin whether on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “No faults”
Reviews.Author: darnfatruler
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this hotel, amazing building, amazing rooms and great location. Very handy for Underground. Breakfast a bit on the pricey side (23 euro, May 2011). Free internet access, sauna, pool, etc. If your looking for a classy hotel in Berlin, the Movenpick is the one.

Reviews.Title: “missing personal items”
Reviews.Author: brian c
Reviews.Content: while the hotel was in a great location - easy to walk to many places and the room was comfortable and breakfast buffet was excellent, you will need to take an inventory of all your belongings before you go out for the day. We came back to our room to discover a number of personal items were missing - camera battery charger, collapsible water bottle, costume jewellery and birth control pills! (unfortunately the safe doesn't hold all your luggage) While the hotel manager feigned interest and conducted an "investigation" with no one owning up to things taken ( like who would and lose their job), we were left feeling like we were not telling the truth - very indifferent to our loss - nothing they could do or did do. spent the next day checking out where to buy another battery charger as we had another 10 days of travel. Overall not how i wanted to spend the rest of my time in Berlin, wondering what would go missing the next day, as minor as it may have been.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Poppinsgarden
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in the middle of September.We had a Superior room overlooking the backyard. The room was quiet and very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was delicious but quite expensive. We would to like to recommend you to order the a la carte breakfast menu instead. The hotel is very conveniently situated, only a five minutes' walk from the Potsdamer Platz. The staff was very helpful and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant !”
Reviews.Author: Joey_denero
Reviews.Content: As soon as I checked in I knew I would have a great stay at this hotel, the staff at Reception were extremly friendly and helpful. The Bar was always staffed with friendly and intuitive Bar servers, a plus ! The breakfast buffet was excellen, a lot of other reviews have mentioned this but I will again, it was great ! Anytime I needed something a kindly emmber of staff was willing to help me. Made my trip a pleasure !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good experience.”
Reviews.Author: ANANDKMOORTHY
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 216 in this hotel for two nights starting Sept. 22. Outstanding is an explanation for this hotel in one word. The room is very spacious, extremely well appointed -- even has a 40-inch Samsung LED TV. The view from the room is rather ordinary though, overlooks the breakfast hall!. But everything else about this hotel is outstanding - the staff are extremely polite, very helpful. We asked for coffee and tea mugs to be given in the room along with a water kettle, and voila, it was there within five minutes. Quite a different experience from the rest of Europe. The breakfast spread is outstanding. They have a big collection of cheeses, muesli, cereals, breads etc. Very nice. The hotel is also conveniently located - about 10 minutes from the hauptbahnhoff and also near the Potsdamer Platz railway station as well as another one... You can walk to the remains of the Berlin Wall within 10 minutes, Checkpoint Charlie is a further 5 minutes from there etc. So very conveniently located. All in all, an amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: touchay
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed here and it was even better than the first. The room was clean and quiet and the service excellent.The hotel is within easy walking distance of Potsdamer Platz with all its leisure facilities and there's an S-Bahn station less than 100 metres away for getting about. I think there's a trend in hotels to limit how cold you can set the air-conditioning (21 on this trip, 18 in a recent stay in a UK hotel) but maybe we should start thinking about the environment for a change rather than whingeing.

Reviews.Title: “The Single Worst Hotel Experience In My Life”
Reviews.Author: RockerLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Simply the single worst hotel experience I have had in my life. We first stayed in a standard room. It was ok, a bit like UK budget hotel chain Premier Inn, but with cheap looking flatpack furniture and a hard bed. The bathroom had glass walls, and while this may be the Movenpick way, personally I do not want to be visible to my partner when defecating. The temperature controls did not work and could not be adjusted below 22 degrees. We moved to a superior room. Here, the bedclothes had what appeared to be bloodstains on them. There were holes in the sheet. The bedside lamps are fixed, and dazzle you when you try to read. The armchair had a heavy layer of dust. In the bathroom,the shower stall has missing tiles and a lot of mould. There was chewing gum on the floor.The lighting is so poorly designed that your face is in shadows when trying to shave in the bathroom mirror. While two staff members we dealt with were courteous and helpful, others, particularly a manager, were rude, patronising and refused to respond to any complaint or accept any criticism. The hotel sent a tray of confectionary as an apology, however, somebody then ate some of the cakes while we were out of the room. We checked out after 2 days, feeling harassed and unwelcome for having complained.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and rubber ducks”
Reviews.Author: lennylou11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last week and was impressed with its cleanliness, overall standards were very high and excellent breakfast with everything you could want to start the day, be it breads, full English, continental, fruits, pastries, smoothes, drinks the lot (22euros expensive if brought on day so make sure you include in package) The hotel is ideally situated near Potsdamer Platz, 10 min walk to Brandenberg Gate, Berlin wall, burning of the books, Hitler bunker, Lego land, check point Charlie and all other sites. Would highly recommend this hotel, all staff were helpful and friendly, bar staff not the quickest but again friendly, gym facilities were ok and very clean Rooms are better than the pictures seem to sell it as, they are of a fair size, very good bathroom and include a rubber duck, mini-bar and TV with sky (free view channels), towels and beds made and supplied daily Set in a old Siemens headquarters building very good conversion. Only suggestion would be in regards the key/card. The card will fail if placed near a mobile phone which I’m sure everyone now has. Would perhaps suggest the hotel goes back to old fashion keys

Reviews.Title: “Again and again”
Reviews.Author: quiltlover
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th stay here. We came first in 2004 when the hotel opened. We like this hotel very much as we think it is very special. Beeing a former bureau building of Siemens, it has a lot of history but lots of modern and stylish parts,too. We have been on floor 3 this time and had a courtyard room. It was very quiet, not very large, just fine in size. They changed the old TVs into new flat screen TV since last year. The beds was comfy as always... Service is very very good from start to a friendly "Auf Wiedersehen" at the´end. Yes, we plan to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: GammelMont
Reviews.Content: Spent a few nights there with my husband and baby. The hotel is nice, clean and comfy, not a 5 stars but good value for the money. I booked on the hotel website and got a good rate including breakfast. Breakfast was good but i wouldn't say exceptional (cf. some of the other reviews). Got a courtyard room and though I slept with open windows, the noise was minimal, I heard some noise coming from the kitchen or the bar (not sure) but it was OK. The staff was helpful and professional, would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “super nice”
Reviews.Author: prevajalka
Reviews.Content: This is really great hotel for great price on a great location. Potsdamer Platz is cca 15 min on foot away. We didn't have breakfast, because it is kind of too expensive (cca 20 eur per person). If you come by car, it is a good idea to reserve a parking space in advance. It is charged 20 eur per night. We wold definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good,clean central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Radler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2010 but I have just got around to writing a review! We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would highly recommend it for its cleanliness and its location.

Reviews.Title: “Moevenpick Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Moe09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here not realishing that is was close to 10 of the best attractions in Berlin. We had a great room on the top level which was really lovely. The staff where very prompt and very freindly, we really enjoyed our six day stay at the Moevenpick, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast Paradise”
Reviews.Author: kaitiScotland
Reviews.Content: Visted this hotel with two teenagers. Very unusual 70's style decor. Large room. Bathroom wall entirely of glass bricks. Not for your maiden aunt! Great service from reception. Able to have adaptor free of charge. Able to pay for Berlin Welcome Card at reception. Great location near Potsdamer Platz and ready access to S and U stations. The public transport system in Berlin is excellent with no ticket barriers and hardly any waiting. 1-3 minutes the norm and my longest wait was 8 minutes. Breakfast buffet was the best I have seen and eaten anywhere. Lots of teas, eggs any style, crepes to order, huge selection of fruit, breads, cereals, cheeses, yoghurts, meats, including steak tatar. Found a new cheese St Albray. I hope I can get it in the UK. Dinner was very quiet and pleasant but let down by little variation in the menu. Good restaurants on the doorstep particularly the Italian Restaurant and Mexican Steakhouse. Potsdamer Platz has a lot of shopping, shows and some restaurants. Our maid was supremely efficient and made up the room while we had breakfast every day but the last. Anhalter cocktail lounge was quirky with nice staff and was a peaceful end to each day. The Anhalter train station is shadow of its pre-war self as a trip inside the station and the nearby Museum of Technology show.

Reviews.Title: “Best value”
Reviews.Author: Billbis
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 8 different hotels across Europe and this was by far the best value I found. Location was great, staff extremely helpful and the hotel was fabulous. The rate I found on Expedia was exceptional. Great way to see Berlin is to rent a bike from the hotel and pedal around to see everything. It's the most bike-friendly city I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Good place if you get a bargain”
Reviews.Author: HasseE
Reviews.Content: Sloppy, rude and uniformed staff. Super expensive wi-fi and the restaurant is exceptionally depressing. If you get a room at a good rate go there but don't expect any kind of professional service.

Reviews.Title: “berlin break”
Reviews.Author: StJ0hn
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel, the location is ideal to explore the city only a few hundred yards from the underground station. Easy to get train from airport to hotel, takes 25mins. The service in the hotel is excellent, staff are friendly and helpful and speak good english. The rooms are modern, clean and stylish, the hotel is quiet and relaxed so a good nights sleep is possible. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as there are cafes in the local area. Really nice city and would stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: MuchtravelledCheadle
Reviews.Content: Just back from three nights in the Movenpick. I can only agree with the positive comments on the site. The building has a history. It was the head office of Siemans and Mr. Siemans was born in Anhaltar Strasse. All the staff were brilliant particularly on the front desk, concierge and in the dining room. Can't comment on the person who did the room as we never saw them - did a good job though. Only had the breakfast which is outstanding. I like anywhere with an egg chef in the morning. We also used the bar which is a little dark (part of the modrenist design) but again very nice staff. Only negative is we had to make our own bed!!!!!!!!! This is because they have folded duvets which you have to unfold yourself. If management are reading this, would you do something with the door to the shower in Room 450 because it leaked water and flooded the bathroom floor. Would love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more for the money”
Reviews.Author: RLM1981
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel and right next to a tube so good transport links. 5-10 minutes walk to Potsdamer Platz. Room was fine, modern decoration and very clean. Bathroom wall see-through though so make sure you're staying with someone you know quite well. Breakfast not included in our rate although it's supposed to be great. As a one-off I think it was about 22 GBP, which felt steep so we declined that option! Only other thing to mention is although the staff seemed polite, they weren't anywhere near as helpful as I think they should have been in a hotel of this quality. Not proactive in helping us check in early, felt like we had to force some recommendations out of the concierge and we found out we actually had 10% left to pay on checkout when the previous communication stated we'd paid up in full. No sympathy from the staff!! Go if you don't mind paying slightly over the odds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Federico1971
Reviews.Content: Been here with a couple of friends to celebrate our 40. The place is very beautiful, clean, close to Potsdamer Platz and very confortable with public transports - S-bahn and U-bahn just one step away. The room was simply perfect and I had one of the best breakfast ever. We had the chance also to dine, the food at Moevenpick is renowned and now I know why. People are always kind and make you feel very well-treated. Definitely a place to enjoy and to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful interior + peaceful setting”
Reviews.Author: kawacathy_11
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with beautiful interiors. Very comfortable and clean. Friendly + helpful staff. Location was a10 mins walk from Potsdam juction but across the road from tube station + easy to get to airport. Breakfast was a good selection. Dinner- most people were having BLT grilled sanwiches. We ordered Salmon which was incinerated + traditional Berlin egg + mash dish which was tasty but overpriced at 10.50 Euro for 3 boiled eggs on a two tablespoons of mash with a drizzle of mustard? There is a brilliant little family bakery /cafe just 3 doors along the road from the hotel that does delicious Italian coffee + omelettes that come with a fresh roll + generous side salad for about 4.50 Euro so that is the best bet for a tasty fresh breakfast / brunch I think.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Picu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 days and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It is a 10-minute walk to Potsdamer Platz and about a 20-min walk to Brandenburg Gate. It is walking distance to the Topography of Terror, Checkpoint Charlie, and the Jewish Museum. You are close to the main sites, but far enough from the tourist crowds. The neighborhood is quiet and we found a small local bakery-cafe around the corner in small shopping center where we could have breakfast for three people for under 10 euros total. The hotel is modern and the rooms very comfortable for 2 people. I found the staff to be friendly and efficient. The concierge service was great in initially orienting us to the city. I would definitely stay here again. They have high-speed internet for a fee in the room and free access at the business center downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive free night”
Reviews.Author: olgaschmelling
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for 3 persons, 2 adults and one child. great offer, 3 nights for 2, one night free. price was 230 euro. Unfortunately there is no such thing as a free lunch. when I checked out the extra-costs for bed for the child, wireless net, breakfast had reached the sum of 260 euro. So total cost for the free night was 260 euro. Total costs for 3 nights: 490 euro! I guess I had come better out if I booked a room at a normal rate, but I got trapped by your special offer and I guess I have to blame myself for being naive. Next time in Berlin I will go for a place with a fixed price. I wont get fooled again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with excellent service and nice location”
Reviews.Author: Pureflame
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed every bit of my stay in this hotel. It is affordable, spacious trendy rooms with high ceiling, friendly staff, clean, good food, quiet location and easy to go any where in Berlin. The famous Postdammer Platz is just 5 minutes walk from the hotel. There are bus stop right outside to bring you to any points in the city. If you stay in this hotel, you can forget using the metro, as busses provide better view of the city. I would definitely come back to this hotel, again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: AnnSargent65
Reviews.Content: Everything you could want from a hotel, including excellent value for money. Its location manages to be in walking distance of most sites, yet be in a quiet location. The staff were all polite, friendly and extremely helpful. Nothing was ever too much trouble. The Alhalter Bar is a complete gem of a cocktail bar. The breakfast buffet is fabulous. I have never seen so much choice and variety, including pancakes or omlette cooked to order. Our standard room was immaculate and the bed was so comfortable. There is a gym and sauna too which were great.

Reviews.Title: “Booked a bit blind but loved it! Great location and great style!”
Reviews.Author: Cookie1990
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel in a bit of a rush and a bit blind if I am honest so was apprehensive on arrival. However, I was extremely pleased when we arrived at a v. modern and stylish hotel that wasn't too far away from train station. Staff were v. helpful and room was great! Easy walking distance to Bradenburg Gate/Postdamer Platz. Didn't sample the food/restaurant but menu looked good. Really made the holiday that wee bit better!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Weekend in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: StephanJudge
Reviews.Content: Staff was impeccable, hotel clean and modern, the funky [kinda 80s] bar made a great cocktail... we had a good time! I would recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Well Situated”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Tomes
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights during a Riviera Travel Firm 3 Night City Break. Having read previous reviews, I would endorse the very pro comments about this hotel. Modern, clean, efficient and friendly helpful staff. We had an excellent room with bath, at the rear of the hotel (but with a pleasant view) whereas others in our group had rooms with showers. Perhaps worth stating which you want when you book in if you have a preference. The excellent breakfasts must also be singled out. It is well placed for getting around Berlin. The Anhalter Bahnhof 'S' Bahn station is only a minute away and Potsdammer Platz with 'U' and 'S' Bahn lines under a 10 minute walk. If eating out there are several restaurants within a couple of hundred yards of the hotel. We found the Italian Ristorante Marinelli (left out of hotel entrance, up to Anhalter Platz & it is diagonally opposite), although crowded, had excellent quick & friendly service. The Filetto Alla Griglia was the best steak I have had for a long time and the wine is also very reasonably priced!.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: sburtoffski
Reviews.Content: I'm glad we stayed in this hotel, because we ended up staying longer than we had originally planned. The room was great, spacious enough, good bathroom and large windows. The room was clean and well maintained and the restaurant and bar were nice. the decore was trendy and the stff very helpfull. Was a good location, quiet and a short walk to Potsdamer platz and checkpoint charlie.

Reviews.Title: “'Great choice'”
Reviews.Author: c13229
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay at the Movenpick Berlin was great. The hotel and its rooms are decorated nicely (modern with a colourful touch, but remain warm and inviting). Rooms and bathrooms are very spacious and there is a great deal of communal space; reception areas, bars etc to relax in. Reception staff were very helpful. Thought the hotel was in a fantastic location, right next to the station very easy to go and see all the sights. Only slight criticism, I think the rooms could be cleaned slightly better, I often found cold coffee mugs were not replaced, empty milk sachets not cleared away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice.”
Reviews.Author: Sweeney1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend sightseeing in Berlin. They waived the 2pm check in and allowed us to check in as soon as we arrived from the airport at 11am which was a great start as we had loads to see and only two days to do it in! The rooms are very nicely furnished with modern designs, they are comfortable and quiet. Breakfast is all good too. Cannot comment on the restaurant though as we ate out both nights, I did notice that the restaurant menu at this hotel was no way near as varied as the Cairo Moevenpick that we visited in January which also has a cantonese only restaurant in addition to two others! The Berlin Moevenpick Location is excellent for getting out and about seeing all that Berlin has to offer, we walked approx 20 miles in the two days we were there but the hotel is located right next to a metro station if you don't fancy walking everywhere! Berlin itself is a brilliant place to visit, it has the perfect mix of history and modern all in one with great public transport, a great example of how a modern city should be. Top place to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice choice”
Reviews.Author: vickyLivadeia
Reviews.Content: I will stay to this lovely hotel again and again and again. I recomented to all my friends that want to visit Berlin. The location is super just next to train and bus station. Very close to everything. Room's space is exactly what you need, bathroom very well designed, we didnt hear anything (very quiet) and the aircondition accurate. The only "problem" is a personal preferance of a double duvet, as we had a double bed but we were sleeping with separate beddings. But this is just a personal need. Overall it's a super choice

Reviews.Title: “nice location to explore berlin”
Reviews.Author: Beatrix81
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days at this hotel, and I really appreciated the location; it is at 5 minutes of walking distance to postdamer platz, from where you can reach every part of berlin by tube or walking. The hotel is very nice and modern, food was great and also staff has been very helpful. Rooms maybe are not so big, but it's the only thing I can complain about.

Reviews.Title: “DIFFERENTLY WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: PPPierpaolo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Movenpick hotel for 5 nights and I was really surprised in finding it clean, central, design and cheap. This hotel was really closest to Anhalter Banhof metro station, perfectly linked to all attractives of Berlin city center, and was near to Postdamer Platz, gainable in a few minutes of walking. Room was truly well designed and induce intense relax despite to the central position of hotel. Whats a pity for breakfast, 22 euro it's too expensive I think.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel with excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DrG_DK
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Mövenpick in Berlin. The hotel is located 5 minutes walking distance from Postdamer Platz in an area with several restaurants. The parking garage is located 300m from the hotel and the S-bahn is only 100m away. The breakfast is really good with a very good selection of hot and cold dishes from a buffet. I got the best omelet I've ever had made fresh by a chef. The room was nice with everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay - Great Price”
Reviews.Author: fife_4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June of 2010, and I booked online through a hotel booking website, and I was very happy with my choice. We got a great deal on the room and it also included breakfast, and the breakfast was good. The rooms were big and very clean and well kept up and the bathroom was nice and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful and quick to answer any questions. The location was great as we could walk to Potsdamer Platz, checkpoint charlie and the Jewish Museum. It was also right next to a subway station that made it easy to get around. There is a 24 hour business centre with 2 computers and a printer that was very helpful and the bar downstairs had a nice atmosphere. I would 100% recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lousybreaks
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Movenpick hotel in Berlin in a superior room, here are the pros and cons: Pros: very clean and quiet, excellent service, good value for money, modern spacious rooms. Cons: if you are not German-speaking do not bother turning on the TV, no free Internet in room, centrally located (10 minute walk from Potsdam Platz/Checkpoint Charlie/Topographie des Terrors) but in dead neighborehood. We did not mind but this is a business hotel. The service in excellent and so are the rooms. The price is also pretty good especially when you combine your hotel with your flight on expedia. As mentioned above the main drawback is its location (neighborehood) even though paradoxiacally it is located near main attractions. We would go back but could be tempted by the competition located in livelier neighborehoods.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- but expensive food + internet”
Reviews.Author: Buddhakkan
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in Moevenpick hotel in October. I would say it’s a nice place. The rooms are cozy. On the first night my room wouldn’t heat up. The staff, though kept assuring me will do something never did… but when the duty manager came along he really helped. I don’t know what he did but everything was finr then on. The hotel is near the S line, which is not connected to everything like the U line but makes traveling convenient, but in Berlin taxis are so cheap that I never took the subway. Potsdamer and Checkpoint Charlie are close to the hotel, but if you are planning to walk be prepared to walk atleast 15mins through a quite dark (in the evening) street. I was alone and was quite uncomfortable with the walk but nothing untoward happened. I did not see any good restaurants near the hotel but I just stayed for 2 nights and I moved to Radission blu after that which is in the middle of everything, so I might be biased. However, the service of this hotel was way better than Radission. The staff and concierge are OK. Being from Asia, I generally find Europe indifferent, and in my opinion Berlin was the rude part of Europe, so it just may be the nature of people there, but they all spoke English and were forthcoming. They also quickly sent me a UK adaptor when I asked. The rooms are nice, quite big and done well, with lots of plug points which were a bonus. The breakfast was good, nothing out of ordinary. The hotel has wi fi but very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel with Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: B8YOU
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with tube station within 2 minutes walk so getting to all the sites around Berlin is easy! Free Breakfast with booking through Expedia and it was fantastic. Reception staff and concierge are very helpful with good and accurate information across the city. Got a UK plug adaptor from them also as i forgot to bring mine. also, fruit and water available in reception when you're checing in/out. Wi-Fi in hotel but far too expensive. Sauna, gym and sunbed for guest to use at the basement. no swimming pool though. Hotel bar doesn't open until 6pm everyday for some strange reason, so no drinking for me and my friends during the day. bathroom sliding door have no lock, it's ok for us but i think it might put some people off. Save deposite box in room. Iron, iron board and kettle available on request only. all free of charge. room very clean and spacious with high ceiling. a great base for Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lousy front desk”
Reviews.Author: dodger73
Reviews.Content: Let's get the good out of the way: Yes, the rooms where very nice and clean, kudos to staff for that. The bad: -When checking in, the person says something about "agencies booking bad rooms, and there are availabilities, so would I like to buy an upgrade". When I say I'll check out the room and get back to him the response is "no, they'll be gone by then". Sounds like a turkish carpet vendor: "Only for you my friend, only today". Next I ask about restaurants in the area. Reply is: "We have an excellent restaurant" Then I ask about a bar/bierkeller in the area. Reply is: "We have an excellent bar" I then manage to convince him that my collegue and I want to go out on the town, this being Berlin and all.. we get a recommendation to some "House of 100 Beers", which turns out to be a tourist trap with high prices and hidden fees. No way anyone would send people there unless there was kickbacks to be bad. He also tried selling me a 14€/day internet connection. No deal. Perhaps it's just me, but I believe that once I've paid for the room, the hotel would stop trying to milk money out of me if I clearly indicate that is not desired.

Reviews.Title: “Very good city hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: KAEandE
Reviews.Content: I arranged a very good value deal that included flights from the UK and 2 nights at this Hotel without breakfast. I travelled with my son (13 - his school was closed for 3 days) so he could practice his German language and we could see some of the sites. The location was very quiet, but only a 10 minute walk or 1 stop on the S-Bahn from Potsdamer Platz. Most journeys we made required a change at Potsdamer platz. The Hotel is in a building of some historic significance, it was built about 100 years ago as the HQ for Siemens, some of the original features remain. Our standard (comfort) room was spacious and very comfortable with very high ceilings adding to the feeling of space. Everything was clean and worked just as it should. The beds were particularly comfortable. We looked onto the inner courtyard, so not a lot to look at but very quiet. An in-room safe is included at no extra charge. There wasn't a lot of clothes storage and some of the shelving was so high-up as to make it impracticable, but I imagine most people are only staying for 2 or 3 nights, so it isn't a major issue. The bathroom was modern, with a deep bath and powerful shower and a reasonable range of complementary toiletries. However, the frosted glass wall separating it from the bedroom won't be to everyone's taste. It made no difference to us, but I'm not sure if my wife and daughter would have cared for it. Reception was efficient and friendly, very happy to highlight sites and give advice. At check-out they immiediately offered to look after our bags and gave us a receipt. We would be very happy to visit Berlin again and stay at the Movenpick.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: ds_read
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in August. We found choose this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and were very pleased with the results. Best value for money in the places we stayed in Europe this Summer. Very clean and modern room and even included breakfast. The staff we very helpful and the service was great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone spending time in Berlin. We found the location great and we spent the two days exploring the city. Look forward to returning and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and cosy. Best mattresses ever!”
Reviews.Author: Angelika09
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Above all - not kidding - for the extremely cosy mattresses. I had not slept so well in ages.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: aygen
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in this hotel mid. of September. I had a very well appointed Junior Suit. It was big, comfortable and stylish. The big plus was the service. From reception to restaurant the service was perfect. The breakfast buffet was very delicious and had a lot of choices. I also had dinner one night and the service & food was excellent. The location is very central. Great money for value.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, great food and location”
Reviews.Author: luvyrlife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights and loved it. Fantastic food (but hey I am very partial to the swiss menu - desserts were divine, breakfasts fantastic), great rooms, exceptionally clean, plush, modern and trendy. Very good location to major tourist sites and underground easy to navigate. Cab fares not expensive to main shopping areas. Staff very professional and friendly. Would absolutely stay here again. We travelled all through Germany and this was the best hotel by far.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lbjames1
Reviews.Content: I went with friends to see them run the Berlin Marathon, and we chose this location because it was central to the start and end points for the race. I guess the hotel chose to capitalize on it and increased the price by at least 25% (if not more) over their regular pricing for the rooms we had (I found this out later). I wasn't pleased, but business is business, I guess. That aside, it's a VERY nice business hotel. There is a restaurant on the first floor that serves breakfast and dinner which is not bad for hotel food and would be good for a dinner with business colleagues; it's mainly swiss-eclectic. The beds are comfortable and you can't hear the person in the next room through the walls. The rooms are European medium to spacious (American small but not cramped). I have no idea if there is a business center, but I suspect there is. It's ideally located around the corner from the Anhalter Bahnhof S-bahn station, so there is quick and easy access to the subway if you need it, but both airports are *at least* a 30 minute to 1 hour ride on the subway with several connections. From a tourist's perspective, it's located within walking distance of a lot of WWII and post-WWII points of interest in Kreuzberg and Berlin-Friedrichstadt neighborhoods (Checkpoint Charlie Museum, Potsdamer Platz, Friederichestrasse, Berlin Wall remains, Topography of Terror, Jewish Museum, tons of historical buildings, etc.), but still several subway stops from Museum Island, the Riechstag/Brandenburg Tor, Unter den Linden, Charlottenburg palace, etc.). Although I did see some children there while I was staying, I don't think the hotel is very kid friendly; for instance, all the furnishings are what my friend described as "stuff i wouldn't want my kid jumping all over", and I don't remember the hotel restaurant featuring a kid's menu. That said I don't think they will turn you away if you show up with your kids in tow. The EUR prices are in line with what I would expect for an upscale business hotel in the US (think Marriott or Hilton Embassy Suites). All in all, I see this a great hotel for business travelers or older tourists looking to explore the WWII/Post-WWII history. I would certainly recommend it to my business colleagues, but not necessarily to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liam5
Reviews.Content: The hotel, staff, services, food, were just great. Hot food brought up to your room from 6-30am till 10-30pm, 24 hour Fitness centre, sauna, Can keep track of your bill on the TV screen, Prices were very reasonable, Location was very handy.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: tianjin2005
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for the August bank holiday weekend, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it as a base for anyone travelling to Berlin for leisure purposes. It is right next to the Anhalter Bahnhof station, and you can jump off and on S bahn and U bahn trains to get to anywhere you need to see in Berlin. Very helpful staff, a lovely room (if sometimes a little warm). We got a special deal which allowed for either a free upgrade or free breakfast.....we'd definitely recommend the breakfast option, as there is lots to choose from and you'll get a good meal to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Location”
Reviews.Author: minky35
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best hotel in this part of Berlin. Excellent location very close Potsdamer Platz right next to Anhalter Bahnhof S-Bahn station and on the fantastic M29 bus route. Beautiful entrance and lobby, plush bar and reception you can see the hotel oozes top quality. The rooms are superb with fantastic storage and expected 4 star facilities throughout. Tea and coffee making facilities are available on request and the staff will provide just about absolutely anything in the line of toiletries and services. The shower was wonderful, the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in the everything about the room was of a very high standard. This hotel would be my first choice in Berlin if the price was right online.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pam307cc
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a four night stay with my 25 yr old disabled daughter, a friend and her 20 yr old daughter. The staff were extremely helpful, the breakfasts were wonderful and the location was good. Despite the fact that 'Last Minute.com' had not passed on our need for a wheelchair accessible room they found one for us and the whole hotel was wheelchair user friendly. They also helped us to locate the lifts at the station and how we could find accessible boat trips on the Spree (go over the bridge when you arrive at Friedreichstrasse Station) . It is about 10 minutes walk to Potsdamer Platz. However, as there were four of us we took a lot of taxis which were much cheaper than in the UK. (The taxi fare from Tegel Airport to the hotel was 20 euros, which worked out as 5 each.) We really enjoyed our stay and felt that all the staff were more than happy to help us. However, the bar and restaurant were quiet and might not suit people looking for lively nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Melissa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights at the end of July. The room was very nice, clean and newly furnished, so this hotel ticks all the boxes. The rooms are spacious, light and airy. The bathroom was modern and spotlessly clean. There were some really lovely touches, a fresh flower in the bathroom and chocolates on the pillows. The TV in the room offered two English stations, however one was unwatchable due to poor reception (we used this to get weather reports). The staff were extremely helpful, and the restaurant which we dined in on one occasion was lovely. The food faultless, some really nice flavours and creative dishes. The price for breakfast and the wireless internet were high, however the there were a few small restaurants surrounding the hotel which severed breakfast. We choose to go to a small cafe (turn right leaving the hotel and walk for 2 mins) and had some of the best pain au chocolats and croissants. It is worth noting that he hotel does have 2 PCs for guests to use, however queues tended to be long and the PCs extremely slow. The location was great! Right on the square is Anhalter Banhof will leads to several of the main sights (Under den linden, Reichstag, Potsdamer Platz) and within a few minutes leads to several connecting underground lines again leading to many amazing sights. A very convenient location for sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Roadtrip75
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights, 14-17 July in room 500. The room was very nice, with two skylight windows over the bed (with two room-darkening shades). Thanks to a quirk in the architecture, I had my own private "balcony" (about 1 sq-m - enough to put a single chair on). I even had a limited view of the TV Tower from my windows. The staff were helpful, and the restaurant was nice (although with so few people eating there, I felt like I was being watched the entire time. I would have preferred more of a crowd so I could enjoy the paper without the staff hovering). The price for breakfast and the wireless internet were a little high, but not out of the expected range for a business hotel in a major city. The location was great! Right across from the S-bahn. A 10 minute walk to Potsdamer Platz and Checkpoint Charlie. A 20 minute walk to the Brandenburg Gate and Unter den Linden.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: wooki481
Reviews.Content: Modern and stylish this hotel ticks all the boxes. Staff are friendly and helpful and rooms are clean and spacious. Small extras such as chocolates by the bed and a rubby ducky in the bath make the Movenpick enjoyably different from other hotels. Breakfast was my personal highlight - an excellent array of cold meats and cheeses as well as cereals, fruit, yoghurts and hot foods with pancakes and omelettes made to order in front of you. Also, don't miss the pastries and cakes - how could I forget!

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, friendly staff, very quiet.”
Reviews.Author: SeaWolf82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot, just next to the Anhalter S-Bahn station, making it very easy to get around Berlin, it's also just a few minutes walk from Potsdamer Platz and the Sony Centre so you don't have to go far to get to things. Staff were very friendly and although the room layout was unusual it was a very nice, clean, modern room. The only downside was the very expensive Internet access, though that's fairly standard for most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Top class service, cleanliness and convenience”
Reviews.Author: missireland054
Reviews.Content: For a 3 day city break this hotel is ideal. Terrific breakfasts to set you up for the day, unusual decor, very clean and (its forte) genuine friendliness of staff without exception. Beside the S-Bahn and very convenient for sightseeing. Didn't appear to be located in a great area and not many places to eat nearby, but they were the only minor drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with an average location”
Reviews.Author: Reiseglad77
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we got a great deal by hotels.com, so I believed that we got 4 stars standard for 3 star price. The standard of the room was great, airly and clean. Surrounding of the hotel is very quiet and there is not so many restaurants and shop nearby, but it takes only 7 min to Potzdams Platz and from there you can get to many destinations in Berlin by S-bahn. We had the discounted price so the breakfast wasn't included and it cost us 22 Euro each for having the breakfast at the hotel, and it's just too much to afford for the breakfast. The only cafe nearby the hotel called Stresemann Cafe was a great disappointment. Long waiting time and poor food. If I next book this hotel, I would pay a littel more extra for having breakfast included in the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: EllieA
Reviews.Content: The service, the room and the food were all excellent. We were greeted by an extremely friendly receptionist and in fact all of the staff were really lovely. The room was huge with plenty of storage and equipped with everything you would need. The bathroom was great and spotlessly clean. There were some really lovely touches, fresh flower in the bathroom, chocolates on the pillows. Our deal was upgraded - choice of better room or breakfast each morning. If you are offered this take the breakfast - we had a booked a superior and room and it was great so we chose the breakfast. The food choice and quality was excellent. The hotel is less than 5minutes to the nearest underground and a 10 minute maximum walk to the Sony Centre so it really is a good location. Would definately stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: UKmidd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in early May 2010. Hotel is in a great location just across the road from Anhalter Bahnhof and is just a short walk from Potsdamer Platz, Checkpoint Charlie and Topography of Terrors etc. Service was extremely efficient and helpful and the room was large, clean and very quiet at night. The bathroom had a large bath and shower. Breakfast was excellent with a huge selection to choose from. Keep an eye out for special offers as we booked a 3 for 2 offer with choice of a free upgrade or breakfast which worked out at less then £70 per night!

Reviews.Title: “All round good experience and something of a bargain to boot !”
Reviews.Author: LionelSladeEsq
Reviews.Content: Great location, central, 50yds from Anhalter Bahnhof S-Bahn entrance, walking distance from Potsdamer Platz, Checkpoint Charlie etc., quiet, welcoming staff. We booked for 3 nights over a weekend so were offered the 3rd night free plus the option to upgrade or take free breakfasts. Take the breakfasts every time, the room was spot on, clean, v quiet and comfortable enough anyway, so enjoy the excellent breakfast buffet, made all the sweeter through the knowledge that you are saving at least 10-15 euros per head. Please don't all go at once though, I want to go back.............

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: C0ffee_Break
Reviews.Content: We spend four nights in Mövenpick. Staff was friendly and polite. Our room was clean and bed comfortable. For us there was not enough closet space, only one tiny wardrope. Bathroom was also nice. There was three small tiles missing on the floor and only one hook for towels. Breakfast was perfect. Everything you could think having for a breakfast was served. Hotels location is also very good. Check point Charlie, Potsdamer Platz, Topography of Terror and German Museum of Technology are in a walking distance from hotel. Anhalter Bahnhof and bus M29 stop are almost next to the hotel. But... At the end hotel was operating like clean, well organized factory. There was no personality or warmth. Hotel is perfect for business travellers, but for families with young children I´m not so sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: neettraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mövenpick Hotel in Berlin at the end of January 2009. It was a really nice surprise when we got there. The Hotel staff was very nice, polite and helpful, eventhough we had booked two rooms for 4 people, and at the end we turned out to be 5 friends. They gave us the oportunity to upgrade to a slightly bigger room for three of us and only for a small fee. The rooms are not that big, but have everything you need. We chose the hotel, because of its location and it turned out to be better than we thought. Within walking distance to Potsdamer Plaz and Brandenburger Thor, as well as the Reichstag. In front of the Hotel is a metro station, so getting there is really easy. The Hotel seems to be pretty new, and everything was really clean. The only but I would say, is that our rate didn´t included breakfast and when we asked for it, it costed around 25 euros per person. But nearby there are some coffee shops. I would defietly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel...ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: corsas
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean, comfotable, friendly modern hotel. Ideal location to all the sightseeing. Had evening meal to room. Very satisfactory. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not even 3 star”
Reviews.Author: jj2221
Reviews.Content: The location is the only reason to even consider this hotel. It is centrally located and close ot all the shops.. Everything else feels run down and the staff is often not interested and rude. The food at the main restaurant is good but is full of passers by and gets very busy. all the staff seemed to be permanently in a bad mood there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: intrepudtraveller
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but the highest of praise for the Movenpick Hotel in Berlin. The staff were always warm and friendly and incredibly helpful (with impeccable English). Despite being quite small my room was cosy, quirky and cool. The bathroom was fantastic - really different but very practical. Overall the decor of this hotel has quite an arty feel, but without being OTT and it made a refreshing and pleasant change to the usual Business hotels. The quality and selection of breakfast was fanastic (though if you arrive close to 10:30 woe-betide the guest who might dare sit at a table already set for lunch - the lady in charge of the restaurant table settings could do with a lesson in manners!!!!!) The hotel is located an ideal 5 minute walk from the heart of the city which makes it ideal for a bit of sight-seeing. The business conference facilities were top-notch including all the daytime catering and refreshment provided. Highly, highly recommended (and also very reasonably priced)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: chrisban
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with two teenage sons in October despite mixed reviews on Tripadvisor. However, we were really impressed by everything about the hotel. Made the booking for 2 adjoining rooms a few weeks ago and got 3 nights for the cost of 2 and a free breakfast every day. A couple of weeks before we were due to travel, saw the same rooms 80 euro cheaper so the hotel kindly gave me the rooms at the lower rate. From the minute we arrived, the staff were very pleasant and extremely efficient. The hotel is well-located with an s-bahn station right opposite and very convenient for travelling everywhere in Berlin. The rooms were very comfortable and very clean. However, our two sons were a bit put off by the glass panel walls in their bathroom! The breakfasts were the absolute highlight. In all our travels, we have never seen such a selection of well-presented, fresh high-quality food and the waiting staff could not have been more helpful. My sons absolutely adored the freshly-made crepes which were incredible! I could really recommend this hotel based on our experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: wise_rita
Reviews.Content: Close location to public transit (both U- and S-bahn stations, though travel was always required as the hotel isn't "right in the middle of the action". Immaculate rooms with a reasonably priced mini bar. Huge bathtub and the rubber ducky was a nice touch. Front desk staff was very friendly, spoke great English and eager to help. Didn't eat at or near the hotel as other reviews scared us off. Wasn't pleased we had to pay for wireless internet. The biggest flaw was the carpet in the hallway, which I thought was ugly and mismatched (totally trivial), so, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it was - but still OK”
Reviews.Author: detoxed
Reviews.Content: Prices seem to have gone up and special deals are more hard to come by since I last stayed a few years ago. The building itself is impressive - the former Siemens building in east Berlin now converted. Location is excellent in a quiet street overlooking an open lawn (not really a park) just a few minutes walk from Potsdamer Platz and well connected on the S-Bahn. The rooms are adequately presented if beginning to date a little. The high point is definitely the dining area in a covered inner courtyard - busy in the morning for a copious if pricey breakfast, quieter in the evening for meals that always impressed. Service varies - restaurant staff were attentive, whereas the reception staff were frosty and generally unhelpful and robotic.

Reviews.Title: “GO AND STAY THERE IF YOU DON'T CARE ABOUT YOU CREDIT CARD BALANCE”
Reviews.Author: vkupcis
Reviews.Content: We were moved to the Moevenpick hotel because of overbooking from a different hotel. The room was prepaid using booking.com service (EUR 228). Nevertheless these clever folks blocked another EUR 318 on my credit card. I was not able to use the credit card during my stay in Berlin. What a nice surprise. After all my attempts to make them to release my money I have only received the promises. After one week my money are still blocked, so I went into overdraft on my current account and still paying the overdraft interest rate. These guys just do not care. Front office staff is ok, most likely they are instructed by management to block as much money as possible "just in case".

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: JKS1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Moevenpick Berlin for five nights in June and have nothing but enthusiastic praise for the staff, decor, location, room rate, etc. We got a great rate at hotels.com for one of the fantastic “designer bathtub” rooms in the attic. The breakfast buffet is as good as they get but at 21 Euros per person it’s overpriced. Other than that we recommend this hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Bland”
Reviews.Author: tomster100
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 1 night in June 2009. Hotel was clean and modern, but lacked any sort of character that makes a hotel welcoming. Staff were OK but as with all the hotels I've stayed in Berlin lacked enthusiasm for their job, they were laid back to the point of being disinterested. Room service not 24 hour and menu fiddly and limited. Food when it turned up was quite good. Had a suite room that was a decent size, although for the price not really worth it. Plenty of room to move about in it though as furnishings were very limited. To be honest, never felt at home. One very annoying feature was automatic blinds that went up and down outside the windows depending on the light levels outside. If you're sleeping in the day the noise will wake you up and when they are down they completely block any view you may have of outside. Another annoying thing was the air-con wouldn't go down low enough, even on the lowest setting the room always felt hot. Not a bad hotel, but for the money well below average in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ChantalGeneva
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights recently - modern, large rooms, well appointed, well located (over the road from the S-Bahn), quiet and excellent service. Lives up to the Swiss standard. In a converted Siemans factory so high ceilings and good space - we stayed on the top floor with mansard roof and velux style windows - lovely views. Kreuzberg location is interesting - try Max & Moritz - Great resto within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and delicate with spacious room”
Reviews.Author: traveller_from_oslo
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in this hotel. Location was good, close to Potsdamer Plats, Checkpoint Charlie, old location of German SS police and other historic sites. Room was on the 3rd floor, very spacious and quiet. Very clean. Breakfast buffet was plentiful although pricey @ 21 euro. Overall a nice experience. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: silverwolf22
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel is not located in Mitte, but it is only two stops away from Pots Platz, and very easily accessible on the U and S Bahns. It is walking distance to Charlie's Checkpoint. There are a few good cafes and restaurants nearby, but these are a little tourist-oriented due to the high number of hotels in the area. Service: Fantastic and friendly front of desk staff. Housekeeping was very good - I asked for a kettle and a custom pillow - both requests were promptly delivered. Room service was also very good. The restaurant in the hotel serves up some Swiss inspired food, delicious! The Room: I got a standard room, with high ceilings and a modern look. Lots of storage and thoughtful details like coat hooks on the wall by the doorway and lights underneath the bathroom step to make sure you don't stub your foot when you go to the bathroom at night. The bathroom's wall is made of glass bricks, so share the room with someone you're comfortable with! The (horrendous) view was blocked out by thoughtful blacked out curtains and the room was spacious enough for a couple. The extras: Love the a la carte pillow menu, also the rubber duck in the shower was a nice touch. I stayed during Easter weekend and a dark choc bunny was left on my desk when I came back from sightseeing. The Moevenpick gets top points for attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a stylish hotel but not without flaws.”
Reviews.Author: Mightycod
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this very modern hotel for three nights to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. We arrived on 29th April and left on May 2nd 2008. We were offered a discounted upgrade on arrival and swapped the Superior room for one of the junior suites in the old loft on the fifth floor. Near an historically important local train station, Anhalter Bahnhof, the hotel is in a quieter area away from the busy central spots. We were able to walk to Potsdamer Platz in around 10-15 minutes, although it is only one stop away on the S-Bahn (getting on at Anhalter Bahnhof a few steps from the hotel). The hotel itself is very stylish, located in the old Siemens headquarters, and has been very thoughtfully designed with a tip of the hat here and there towards the old and continuing activities of the company which once owned the building. In the bar some of the tables were supported by glass insulator stacks, such as those that you see hanging from pylons. In the room the shower room door was like that which you'd find in a factory, sliding across on a rail. There was a lot of funky lighting and use of different materials to theme the look of the place. We found the staff at the front desk very pleasant, informative and efficient: just as you'd except from German staff working for a Swiss hotel chain. However, we did think it was a bit off when tried to go to bed and had to wait quite a while following our request a pillow containing man-made stuffing, as all the bedding contained feathers, which my wife is allergic to. We phoned the front desk at around 11.30pm and were told that it would take an hour and a half to get the pillow sent up. This was because there was only one staff member at the desk and they were not allowed to leave until another member of staff turned up at 1am. I wasn't able to collect it myself as the person at the desk would still have to leave to go to the store room. Our only other real criticisms were as reflected in one or two other reviews here. The hotel seems a little too eager to (over)charge for everything. Breakfast was to be a whopping 21 Euros each... It would have to be some breakfast for us to have paid that! A cheaper alternative is the Stresemann Cafe on the corner, near the S-Bahn station. The minibar in the room was also fairly expensive, as they tend to be in most hotels, and the main bar near the lobby and entrance was way overpriced at over 4.50 Euros for a 0.5l glass of beer. The inflated prices and persistent charging for everything actually put us off having a meal in the hotel's modern restaurant and we went elsewhere. We loved Berlin itself. The people were friendly, the service generally very good, there was a lot to see and a year ago would have been good value for a capital city (we got stung with the poor Pound versus Euro rate which made it an expensive visit!) Berlin isn't the prettiest of cities but there's never a shortage of things to do or places to eat and drink. There's bags of history, especially recent world history, and the people are very welcoming and keen to show what modern Germany is about. We were there during a public holiday and the avenue leading away from Brandenberg gate was heaving with people having a street party. They were mostly eating currywurst hotdogs and drinking beer to the sound of a live band. The atmosphere was lively and we joined in with the Berliners as if we belonged there! Highlights for us included seeing the remaining parts of the Berlin Wall and visiting the Jewish museum and Olympic stadium. The round trip bus tours are better value than some cities as there is a lot to see and takes around two hours to do the full tour. The public transport is excellent and a day pass covering both the U-Bahn and S-Bahn are great value for money. Get in early for the Reichstag. We queued for an hour to get in but the queue hardly moved and it was a hot day. They only seem to let a relatively small group in every half an hour. We gave up and sadly missed out on one of the main attractions. There were plenty of other places to go. We found the Sony Centre at Postdamer Platz to have a good atmoshere and ate at a couple of restaurants there. The Josty restaurant was recommended by our guidebook but we weren't impressed. We had to move to be served, the menu wasn't very logical and I paid 14 Euros for a pizza which tasted as though it was straight from a Findus or McCain factory. The waiter also stood waiting for a tip. We enjoyed the Lutter & Wegner restaurant just outside, near the shopping arcade and casino. It cost around 80 Euros for a starter, main and coffee each plus a bottle of wine. All in all a really good trip. I would happily agree that the Moevenpick Hotel was a good place to stay, but I wouldn't go out of my way to recommend it as somewhere vastly superior to anywhere else. That's not to say that we didn't enjoy our stay there on the whole and it was clean and very stylish in a modern way; just one or two minor irritations. Berlin is well worth visiting if you like history, museums, food, theatre, quality shopping and big city buzz. We'd go again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Service and Value for the Cost”
Reviews.Author: Journeyman920
Reviews.Content: After spending hours reading through reviews and about various hotels in Berlin, I selected this hotel based on positive reviews and its location. My fiance and I were celebrating our 8 year anniversary while at the hotel, so I was willing to splurge some to have a nice room and great location. The location did not disappoint, as it is very centrally located to most of the museums and historical sites. However, my fiance and I enjoy walking and put in atleast 10 miles a day anyways, so we would have been almost as happy with any location within 15 blocks of this hotel to save on cost, as the location was not enough to warrant the price. We spent $175 a night for the basic room, and I was quite surprised with how small and cramped the room was. We had requested the highest possible floor (for a quiet room) and a view of the river, and they did grant these requests which was nice. However, the front desk staff was not particularly friendly or welcoming. We expected them to be after reading some other reviews, and at first we thought it might have been a cultural difference, but other people in Berlin at restaurants and museums were much friendlier. Everything was very clean, but the first morning the shower rod, which was apparently loose, fell on my fiance's head during his shower. We borrowed a power adaptor to charge our camera batteries from the hotel. After bringing it to our room, we discovered it didn't work, so we immediately brought it back to the front desk. They didn't have another one to lend us, which wasn't a big deal, but they accused my fiance of breaking it and asked him what he had done to it. The worst part of our experience involved laundry service. I clearly filled out the laundry form requesting that a jacket be dry cleaned and a pair of jeans be washed.
