As we were at a fairly expensive hotel compared to the general hotel costs in Berlin and a hotel which had a lot of amenities, I never dreamed that this service would be so lacking, so I didn't check the laundry for 1 day after receiving it back until I went to put the jeans on. They had not been washed as instructed, but dry cleaned, and they still smelled of airplane. When I told the front desk, they refused to do anything saying that we hadn't told them within 1 hour of receiving the laundry back. As we spent $600 here, I was not overly concerned about $10, but it is more about principle and how the hotel treated us. We have traveled through more than 25 countries and stayed at atleast 100 different hotels and I have never been treated like this. Before this incident, I felt that the value for what we were spending was not there, but after this incident, I am sure I will never choose this hotel or any hotel in this chain again. If you do stay at this hotel, I would definitely opt out of the breakfast and would not eat in the hotel at all. The food in the hotel is very expensive considering that food in Berlin is generally very cheap as far as big cities go. We had the breakfast 1 morning, and even at the 2 breakfasts for the cost of 1 rate, which you get with the special membership card you can sign up for for free on their website, I felt that this breakfast was majorly overpriced. At $15 per person, I would have expected a very large spread with a lot of hot breakfast choices, particularly regarding egg dishes. They would only fry eggs and there was very limited hot food. I could have easily bought a few pastries, of which they had a lot of, and a glass of juice for $5 per person elsewhere. The breakfast staff was much friendlier than the front desk staff. Regarding food in Berlin, it is easy to find great deals and high quality. I really recommend the Hasir Turkish Restaurant as well as the many kebab and falafel restaurants sprinkled through the city. They are a great value. Overall, I just don't think the value you get from this facility warranted the cost I paid. I especially expected better service from the staff. I would not choose this hotel again, mainly based on principle and value.

Reviews.Title: “A positively satisfying experience”
Reviews.Author: GiantPanda28
Reviews.Content: The Moevenpick is well located just across the road from an S-Bahn station and within walking distance to the Potsdamer Platz and Checkpoint Charlie etc. We stayed in the junior suite which was spacious and quiet. Everything is well-designed and funcitional - in the true spirit of Bauhaus. However, what made this hotel stand out is the quality of the service. All the staff were extremely polite, pleasant and very helpful. We asked for extra pillows one evening and these were brought to our room within minutes. They also kept us informed of our late arriving bag and brought it to our room as soon it arrived. The breakfast is very good, although a bit expensive now at 21euros, especially with the devalued Sterling but it was good quality food and plenty of it. So all in all, it was a positively satisfying experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and a great Location”
Reviews.Author: Joey1234
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Movenpick for 3 nights and really enjoyed the stay. We had a junior suite which was a huge room and it is a very stylish hotel. Only thing I would suggest is that the TV should really be a larger LCD type considering the size of the room. Excellent location 100m from the nearest SBahn station (Anhalter) and there is some nice cafe / restaurants nearby Cafe Strassman and an Italian restaurant on the corner across from Cafe Strassman that was one of the best Italian food we had (outside of Italy) and excellent value -not even 40 euro for 3 courses each, tea and 2 Erdinger. The staff was excellent and very polite and the bar in the hotel called the Anhalter bar was very nice with great design. Nice touch as well is the free water, fruit and chocolate provided from free daily in your room.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: laurence_c
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend this hotel - very friendly and helpful staff, a lovely stylish bedroom and fantastic breakfasts. The hotel's in a great location for sightseeing, and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “high quality -minimalist experience”
Reviews.Author: EsotericKent_UK
Reviews.Content: went for new year package. Beautiful new years buffet (truly fabulous food) we then were taken to the top of a shopping centre (rooftop) for new year champagne and fireworks Excellent staff, beautifully designed room with roll top bath in middle of room. Minimalist loft type feel with Japanes style bed (gave me back ache) Hotel all in fab taste and a nice trendy bar(although expensive) Really Superb breakfasts too and very handy for the S Bahn.(2 minutes) down sides -lack of coffee making facilities in room (this is common in Germany) and I also would have liked a nicer reception/lounge area for occasionally escaping family for 10 minutes. Wasnt really anywhere cosy to sit . Also a bit of a lack of space for clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for sights of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Pit-yacker
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellently located for the major tourists sites of Berlin, with Potsdamer Platz, The Reichstag, Topographie des Terrors, Checkpoint Charlie, The Brandenburg Gate, Holocaust Memorial, etc, etc. all being in easy walking distance. Whilst, the hotel is less convenient if your main reason for visiting Berlin is shopping (as it is some distance from Kurfürstendamm), the hotel does lie on the route of an excellent bus service that passes the main shopping area and public transport tickets are available from the hotel concierge. Other public transport links including Anhalter S-bahn (subway/underground) station that is virtually outside the hotel and a U-bahn (another subway/underground system) station at Potsdamer Platz are also close by for things which aren't so close. I found the hotel staff friendly and helpful at all times. Although, it isn't cheap, in the evening, the hotel restaurant serves some of the best food I have tasted. The regular buffets, are more affordable, however, don't appear to be made to quite such a high standard with food often being of lower quality than the main menu. The Buffet food also sometimes has a tendency to be slightly dry due to being left out so long (a problem that also afflicts the cooked buffet items at breakfast). The rooms are clean and comfortable and have a very modern style. The hotel appears to have good facilities, and I found the hotel staff friendly and helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Breakfast to die for.”
Reviews.Author: koritsi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of days, whilst my son was on business. The reception staff were friendly and helpful and even found the nearest branch of my favouriteshops - KaDeWe and Kaufhof and marked them on a city map for me. The room overlooked the glass roofed dinng room, so no view but I didn't spend much time there.The room was large and warm, which was very welcoming as there was a really cold wind, despite the sun. The beds were comfortable with lovely warm duvets. The bathroom was big, well designed and tiled -floor to ceiling in the same style I'm not a regular of hotels so my perception may be a bit biased but the breakfast set me up for the day - sausages, bacon, eggs, smoked salmon, several different cold meats and cheeses, several types of muesli, jams, marmalades, quark and of course as well as white bread and rolls, a huge selection of healthy German sonnenblumen and rye bread, good coffee, several teas and juices. This is probably standard hotel fare but good quality all the same. The location, once I'd worked it out, was great. It was a short 15 min walk to Potsdamerstrasse, very near the Topography of Terror, Checkpoint Charlie, The Jewish memorial, Brandenburg Gate etc - mind you I like walking. I'd definitely stay here again. The thing I disliked the most was having to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at this great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cabbagetown
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at Movenpick Hotel in Berlin. Rooms are big and feel big with the high ceilings of this former Siemens Electric building. Bathrooms are very modern with the stand-up showers with shared tile with the bathroom tile. Vanity is similarly modern chic. The glass block wall lets light into the bathroom and fits the modern loft feeling of every room. Front desk service is polite, not overly friendly, but polite and professional. I always appreciate the complimentary fruit and water (still and gas) at the front desk. The beds are extremely comfortable and their are nice design touches in the room. Great linens and very comfortable duvet. The 19 Euro breakfast is pricey but is of very high quality with an nearly infinite selection of items. Everything is fresh and quality is very good. The location is ideally located close to Potsdamer Platz, which is merely a 7 minute walk to the hotel. Skip the "Mexican" restaurant close to the hotel. My steak fajita arrived in a sauce that you typically don't expect when steak fajitas come to your table on a sizzling iron skillet!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Amazing City”
Reviews.Author: RD114
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Movenpick for 6 nights in August, and we loved it! From the moment we arrived, we knew we were in for a good stay. The hotel staff were charming and thoroughly helpful. We booked a Deluxe Roof Room (highly recommended), and we loved the layout, design, and size of the room. The many windows provided ample light, and the Phillipe Stark bathtub was a cool addition to the room. At night, it was very easy to make the room entirely dark using the internal and external shades. We were traveling with our three year old son and the dark room helped him sleep until very late each morning. The hotel staff provided us with a bed our son at no cost (arranged ahead of time). It amounted to a very large portable crib, and he was very happy with it. I had read other reviews that said that the air conditioning is lacking, but we did not find this to be so. We were very comfortable during our entire stay. The location of the hotel is perfect--with two train stations at your doorstep (one on the same block, the other a very short walk away). Berlin was amazing--definitely a city worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “stylish rooms, non-central location”
Reviews.Author: adventurerette
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel - and really rather reasonably priced, which I'm assuming is because of the somewhat out-of-the-way location. Location: not central Berlin, but right next to a metro line to get into the city. There's not a lot going on around the hotel, to be honest, although the hotel bar seemed nice enough (if not the hotbed of chic that the website would have you believe). Cleanliness: spotless. As you'd expect. Style: warm yet minimalist - kind of a plush Ikea, if that makes any sense. Everything was rather nice. Rooms: we chose a fairly big room, which had both a free standing bath inside the room and a separate shower cubicle in the washroom. It was up in the eaves and therefore you have to be careful with the sloping ceiling. The rooms were great, with a mini-bar fridge and generally well laid out with amenities. Huge bed with crisp white linen. Quietness/privacy: we couldn't hear our neighbours. We had a very relaxed stay in this hotel. Faciliites: we only used the bar, which was fine, but in April 07 at least they seemed to stop serving food very early on. There was no 24 hour room service. Obligatory shoe-shine machines on each floor, and provided iron and ironing board on request. Didn't use the restaurant at all, or any other facilities at the hotel. Check in: the front desk were really helpful and friendly, although when we got back at about 2am on a Sunday morning (this is party Berlin!) there wasn't anyone around for a bit to let us back in to the hotel which was a bit annoying. Overall: excellent hotel, was extremely good value for money, but if you want to be in the "thick" of things you will find the neighbourhood very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Galtech
Reviews.Content: Just back from a two night stay at the Berlin Movenpick. As other people have mentioned, the location is fantastic - within 20 mins you could walk to Potsdamer Platz, Holocaust Memorial, Reichstag, Checkpoint Charlie, Berlin Wall and Jewish Museum. There's a S-Bahn station just a hundred yards from the hotel, plus a U-Bahn station a few minutes walk away. The hotel has stylish decor, is very clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. We were lucky enough to have a luxury room on the top floor, which was very spacious, loads of roof windows. Even though the hotal was fully booked, we never heard a sound from any other guests, and had perfect sleep in the comfortable beds with super-soft duvets! I'd recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Berlin, brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nwat
Reviews.Content: just back from Berlin - and this hotel was great. From the helpful and friendly staff, to the clean well equipped rooms and the little bedtime 'snacks' beside the bed! It's really well located for access to the touristy stuff - or hire a bike from one of the many hire companies for around 12 euros for the day and travel further afield (loads of cycle paths and it seems it's THE way to travel in Berlin). There's also great U-bahn and S-Bahn and bus access all over the city from the hotel. The little mexican restaurant next to the hotel is great for a tasty and filling meal, and the cafe on Stressemann strasse (stressemann cafe) does great (and cheap!) breakfasts. The hotel restaurant is a bit more expensive but the food is really good, the service fantastic, and the Moevenpick Ice Cream to die for!! All in all a fab trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Petra008
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel in 2006, and that was one of the best hotels I stayed in… Very friendly staff and what I just can’t forget is the fruit that they had at the reception… Don’t know if they still give free fruits but we all just liked the idea. I had a single room that was really big with a great bathroom. We were there for a business stay and we also had meetings in the hotel conference rooms… good equipment and again friendly staff. Great choice for a break in Berlin…

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mx_Ita
Reviews.Content: Great quiet hotel that seems to be at first unconviniently located but in reality is central with the new modern Berlin. The S metro station located just outside the hotels helps enormously with touring town if you're not into walking. Lobby and public spaces are modern and the retractable roof in the restaurant gives an interesting "al fresco" spin to your breakfast or dining. Rooms are quite large, but from my understanding not many of them have an interesting view (we had courtyard view). Bathrooms are also large, however the wall separating the bath from the room is made by glass blocks so lighting up the bath at night means lighting up the whole room :(( Staff is helpfull and very cordial. Breakfast is fairly good with a good range of choices. Had dinner at the hotel restaurant one night and chose the buffet, but wasn't too happy with the quality (at best fair). Fit center and sauna are quite limited in space and sauna is co-ed, but if you're into the whole sauna/solarium try the very close LiquidRom (great experience!!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, great location!”
Reviews.Author: elaine1733
Reviews.Content: This is such an amazing hotel.The rooms were beautiful, modern and spacious. The staff went over and above to help make our stay fantastic. The location is ideal, just down the road from Potsdamer Platz and Checkpoint Charlie. There is an S Bahn stop 2 minutes away on the same street. This hotel deserves top marks in all categories and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: pam89
Reviews.Content: Rooms Spacious and nicely decorated room with a modern, pleasing interior. Very comfortable bed. The room was equipped with a safe big enough to fit a laptop and other electronic devices. Closet space is sufficient, but not generous. The hotel in general and facilities Very nice breakfast buffet. Rooms have Wifi internet access for a fee of EUR 22 per day. The hotel also has a gym with three or four cardio machines and one multi-purpose weight machine. Given that there is enough space in the room, the hotel should consider installing some more weight machines. Service Staff was extremely attentive and friendly and paid attention to details, such as always addressing me with my name. Location The hotel is very centrally located at Anhalter Bahnhof, about 800 meters from Potsdamer Platz.

Reviews.Title: “smart and funky”
Reviews.Author: niks216
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here, friendly and helpful staff, compact size room but enough space. nice interor decor, good restaurant downstairs, we didn't eat there but had some great icecream and if it had been warm enough when the roof was off we would have. Good breakfast buffet and a good location 1 stop from potsdamer platz. would definitely recommend it. Try Monsieur Vuong if you like asian food, shiro i shiro was a little dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: saralou18
Reviews.Content: I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for convenience, quiet rooms, friendly staff and good food. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Funky Moevenpick”
Reviews.Author: Pressure_Drop
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Moevenpick for 3 nights in April and had a great stay in this funky, colourful hotel. Surprisingly quite large, but still had an intimate friendly feel to it, reception was quick and efficient and we took advantage of their upgrade offer which I took out when originally booked, basically it meant if an upgrade was available on the day you would get it at a much cheaper price - can't remember how much but it certainly made it worth while. The suite we had was room 206 on the top floor, our friends had 210 which although they paid the same wasn't a patch on ours and although equipped the same was much larger, so if you get the choice go for room 206. Probably one of quietest hotels I've ever stayed in although in a quite busy area of Berlin, other things to mention, great choice for breakfast although pretty expensive (19.50 euros) - great if you fancy stuffing your face in the morning but if you just want a bowl of cereal you can go for a cheaper option.Tried the bar one evening which was pretty good although a little quiet unfortunately, but great for a nightcap. Bars worth mentioning nearby: Solar bar which is on the top floor of a hotel within walking distance - go to your left when you come out of the Moevenpick and look for the glass lift on the outside - great views, good cocktails, not too pricey, surprised no one else has mentioned it - there's also a great little authentic German bar just around the corner (Stadtklaus) again on the left, just past the kebab place - resembled a church inside, all wooden pews and religious icons, weird really. Bar to avoid, on the crossroads as you look at it coming out of the hotel on the left again, there's one bar right on the crossroads (opposite the decent Italian people have mentioned) which is ok, but just down from that there's another bar where the landlord stunk of B.O. and made you as welcome as a f*rt in a diving suit. He even refused to serve as wheat bar as it was 'Bavarian p*ss water' according to him. The Moevenpick is really well located for all the main Berlin attractions - S-Bahn is right outside but there's plenty of good stuff nearby, Checkpoint Charlie, Topography of Terror, Brandenburg Gate, Jewish Museum - all close by, couple of other places worth a visit - classy Italian restaurant 'Sale e Tabbachi' and the 'Jazz bar' both within walking distance - Jazz bar especially worth a visit, quality beer and decent bar food, great atmosphere - if you like jazz, funk or soul - nice.... All in all, couldn't fault the Moevenpick - can highly recommend a stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Well Above Average”
Reviews.Author: jab58
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading reviews by fellow travellers. Converted to a hotel in 2004 the building has had a varied past and narrowly missed destruction in 1945. The location is fairly central and quiet, within easy access of transport and walking distance of most sites. We ate in the restaurant trying the buffet which was excellent value. As mentiones by another reviewer the Italian nearby is worth a visit. The breakfast selection is probably the most varied I have seen and should suit everyone. Helpful staff was also a bonus, well done.

Reviews.Title: “Fab friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick69
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this very friendly and efficient hotel in Berlin. Good location, quite central, which was useful as the public transport strike was still on!! We had a delux roof top room with a bath in the room-well worth it and a nice touch of luxury. The breakfast buffet is one of the best ive seen and we also had dinner in the restaurant which was excellent (the roof can open up in the warm weather). The bar is very funky and serves great cocktails, shame there wasnt many people in there (in fact the hotel was very quiet overall) to add to the atmosphere. Would love to go back and see Berlin in the summer and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caseybecks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend and wished we could have stayed longer!!! The Hotel was ace. We booked the special hotel deal: breakfast, dinner one night, 3 day travel pass plus packed lunch. What a great idea. Staff were nice and friendly. Room was as funky as the hotel. Only 100 metres from the under ground station. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: tonedeaf
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a short break in this modern hotel. Room was large and clean with funky glass wall to the bathroom. Breakfast was good, but a bit busy at times. Hotel is located within walking distance of most attractions. Berlin was a lovely city. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: gazza613
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Appearance is not conventional - quite funky. Facilities were good. All very modern. Breakfast was not included for me so I cant comment. I didnt eat there at all. Location seemed ok - about a 10 minute walk to Potsdamer Platz. Probably about a 10 - 15 minute walk to Check Point Charlie. All I know is that in December 2007 when I was there even a 1 minute walk was 59 seconds too long because it was so cold. The room was modern and bathroom was fantastic - best I have seen so far in Europe. Big glass shower, free standing bath and plenty of space. Smoking inside seemed all to common - the only negative aspect. Especially on the way to the lifts where there seems to be a designated smoking area so you have to walk through the stench of old smoke on your way to your room. Overall - good hotel. Reasonable price. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Mövenpick Berlin”
Reviews.Author: laughingsheep
Reviews.Content: Location ======== The hotel is located about 5 mins walk from Potsdamer Platz and about 1 minute from the Anhalter Bahnhoff. Most of the big tourist attractions of East Berlin are walkable from the hotel, (the big shopping area on Fredrich Strasse, Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, Museum Island) and notably Check Point Charlie and the Topography of Terror which are within 5-10 mins walk. Rooms ====== The hotel is an old building which has been renovated to a good standard with a very modern finish. The bedrooms are bright, clean and spacious, with large windows which could be opened to keep the room well ventilated. Unfortunatley the aircon in the room had a relatively high minimum setting, which, had I been staying during the summer, wouldn't have kept the room cool enough for my tastes. As mentioned by other reviewers, the bathroom walls (seperating the bathroom from the bedroom) are are unusual in that they are constructed from opaque glass blocks. I didn't find this to be a problem, as they are opaque and only outlines can be viewed through them, however, the extremely shy or modest may find them to be a problem! Toiletries provided in the bathroom where functional, with the shower gel provided in a full sized unit that was fixed to the wall, making it more convientent than the small travel sizes provided by some hotels. A nice touch was the pillow 'menu' which allowed you to select your pillows from a choice of about 5 or 6 different styles. Food ==== We ate breakfast in the hotel as the breakfast buffet was included in the room rate. There was a good selection of cooked food, cereals, bread and fruit which was replenished frequently at busy times. We only had dinner in the hotel once for during out stay, on the evening of the Swiss buffet which provided a good selection of pleasant food, although nothing out of the ordinary. Value for money =============== We stayed in the hotel on their Surprisingly Different package, for 6 nights. This was a bed and breakfast rate which also included a dinner for 2 with a bottle of wine, free drinks in the bar on 2 evenings from 5-7pm, a packed lunch on a day of your choosing and 2 3 day travel passes. We enjoyed our stay and would seek out Mövenpick hotels in the future following our experience in Berlin. Overall a good value package, especially for longers stays. For shorter stays the per night rate increases and offers poorer value for money, but still worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dok
Reviews.Content: I reviewed all the hotel's via Trip Advisor and opted for this one - and what an excellent choice! First for the location and closeness to the S & U Bahn 200 yard walk to the front of the hotel. The reception staff could not have been nicer. We opted to take the upgrade if it was available and we got a delux room. The reviewer who complained about the pillows did not avail of the a la carte pillow menu - excellent as I am allergic to feathers. The chocolates on the pillows and the free water we thought to be a nice touch. We also booked the Suprisingly Different package and took the meal on the first night we arrived .... what a delight on the palate . The hotel is within dandering distance to the Potsdammerplatz which is a great location for picking somewhere else to eat. Don't rule out the Italian down from the hotel at the crossroads - a tasty bite without travelling too far. Berlin surprised us on the whole and is in our top 10 of European cities.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend trip to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ba-chief
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for a trip to Berlin: The Hotel is located south of Potsdammerplatz, Brandenburger Tor, Reichstag, Sony Center, and Potsdammer Platz Arkaden are only a short walk away. Public transportation is right in front of the hotel (S- / U-Bahn, Bus). The hotel itself was completely reimburshed in 2004 and following has a modern style. The staff is very engaged and always offered a helping hand. The quiet room was a little bit small, but ok and had a great view. To sum up, we would book it again for a trip to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday treat to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: HodgeWoods
Reviews.Content: Booked three days under the "Surprisingly Different" package and applied for upgrade to Junior Suite for 12 Euros per night. Great welcome, room exceeded expectations and the package was great value. The hotel was so quiet at night that we thought that we were the only guests - not so as the restaurant was very busy on Sunday morning. The 4 course, chef's surprise, evening meal was excellent and the huge packed lunch kept us occupied at the airport on day of departure. I had mentioned that it was my husband's birthday on checkout day - a really nice touch was the delivery of a birthday card and small gift that morning. Very well located for Checkpoint Charlie and great access to the S & U Bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: charliexx
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel...its a hotel i will remember - Especially the wonderful room. The only complaint was the lack of English channels and movies - Its not very enjoyable watching american movies dubbed in german when you understand about 3 words in total... An international hotel should always cater for english speaking guests - not only german speaking guests.

Reviews.Title: “Pick of the best”
Reviews.Author: slickoperator
Reviews.Content: So I went online and booked this hotel through lastminute.com, which also meant the booking included breakfast. It was also surprisingly cheap considering this is a four star hotel. Anyway, the low-down is, quite simply, this is one of the best hotels you can stay in in Berlin for this kind of price. The staff are very well-mannered and unfailingly helpful; the room I was given was clean, comfortable, and pleasant. There's a very nice restaurant downstairs with a glassed-in atrium and you'll notice that many people visit it from outside who are not guests (a very good sign). Coming from the UK, I was very aware that prices at the restaurant and at the hotel were lower than I would expect. This hotel is definitely value for money. I'd say the only slight drawback is that it's about 10 minutes' walk from Potsdamer Platz. That's not great if, during your stay, it's snowing or raining heavily, as it was on both the days I stayed here. But taxis are plentiful and comparatively inexpensive. I'm quite a choosy person when it comes to hotels. But given the price I would recommend this one unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Bahadir
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful hotel. The room I stayed (220) is a huge room, with high ceilings and modern furnitures, with tasteful design. The front desk was friendly and attended immediately everything I asked for. I would certainly stay here again if I come back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and with apathetic staff, but good location”
Reviews.Author: fifey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon at the end of September, having booked the accomodation directly with the hotel. The location is pretty good as it is about ten minutes walk from Potsdamer platz, and there is an U/S-bahn station (Anhalter Bahnhof) nearby. However there are very few restaurants/cafes in the vicinity and the hotel bars didn't tempt us. The room (a junior suite) was clean and spacious. There was a bath and sink in the room itself, in a tiled area at one end of the room. The shower and toilet were in another room. However, some of the mosaic floor tiles were missing and others came out during our stay, giving it a slightly shabby look. The air conditioning was very loud but without it, the room would have been too hot and stuffy. There were no complimentary refreshments except one bottle of water (and for some reason, only one glass in a double room), although there was a minibar. The leisure facilities were a bit disappointing, especially when compared with other Moevenpick hotels. There was a small sauna and a small gym and that was it. We did enjoy our stay here, but it is a corporate and faceless chain hotel. The staff did not even bother to say "hello" when we walked through reception each day and when we checked out, did not ask if we had enjoyed the stay. I was also quite surprised that even though they were aware we were on our honeymoon, they did not make a single goodwill gesture (in comparison with the York Marriot, where we stayed on our wedding night, who generously gave us chocolates and champagne). Overall for the price we paid (over £100 per night which did not include breakfast) I would have expected better leisure facilites and a better selection of refreshments in the room.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: els62
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Moevenpick for 4 nights. Had junior suite on 5th floor. Great decoration. Incredibly comfortable bed. Superb choice of pillows. Loved the sloping ceiling and Velux windows. Bathroom looked cool but not everything worked as it should - tap on the basin was a little temperamental. But that was only a slight hiccough. Best thing was the sound-proofing. You could not here a thing from outside. Restaurant served delicious food and the service was exceptional. Wine list was also extensive with wide range of world wines. Staff were outstanding and helped make the all-too-short trip even more pleasurable. Many thanks. Do not hesitate to stay at this marvellous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Modern Upscale Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ambough
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 night stay in mid-June 2007, and enjoyed our visit at the Movenpick at great deal. I would return & recommend it to others. Nicely remodeled bldg near Potsdamer Platz & central sights, within easy walking distance of many restaurants & the local S-Bahn and U-Bahn train system. It was our first visit to Berlin and we had no problems navigating the city and transportation systems from the airport. Nicely furnished hotel and helpful staff, although buffet breakfast at 18 Euros was quite expensive. Pastries/coffee just down the street were a cheaper and tastier option.

Reviews.Title: “Pick the Moevenpick”
Reviews.Author: SoMo30
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels on city breaks but the Moevenpick outshines them all. We stayed in a suite on the top floor and loved our room. We had plenty of space but what we really liked was that the room had a great balance of being contemporary and homely. It was the type of room that you don't feel you need to get out of and into open space. We had a bed with two single quilts - what a fantastic idea! There was no quilt ping-pong for the night - one person throwing it down cause they were too hot and the other pulling it up. A great bench at the end of the bed - a shelf underneath for handy storage and the bench doubles as a seat for room-service. We had a bath and sink in the room with an en-suite toilet and shower. My husband took to the lovely two seater in the room also. Perfect size to curl up in and watch tele for a while. The mini-bar was reasonably priced for drinks. We had a glass of wine with our room-service lunch on the day we arrived. Both were very tasty and reasonable. Besides the room, what makes this hotel is the staff. They were fantastic. It was my birthday during our stay and they went out of their way to make it that bit extra special. It is always the little extra personal effort that doesn't make you feel like a number in a hotel. At the moevenpick we not only didn't feel like a number but we felt really special. Well done staff - and thanks! We ate at the hotel restaurant one night and were sorry we hadn't done it sooner. The food was lovely and great value. We had breakfast included in our package and it was fantastic. We could have spent all day picking. Everything was so fresh and tasty. As others have mentioned we also found this hotel to be very conveniently located with the S-bahn outside the door and Potsdamer Platz only stop away. We went to Berlin not knowing what to expect. We loved the city and spent plenty of time exploring, and we loved the hotel. Well worth the visit to both.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fantaki1
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Very modern (slightly small) rooms. Great location. In front of an S-bahn station. We got a great deal online (90 euros).

Reviews.Title: “wondeful stay”
Reviews.Author: elpep
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited Berlin for a week's holiday. We found the Movenpick, (or however you're supposed to spell it) to be very, very good. As it was our first time in the city and at the hotel they gave us a suite instead of the normal room we had booked. The room was fabulous, with lots of space and the bathroom was wonderful. Every morning they replenished the fruit in a little bowl and replaced the chocolates my girlfriend liked so much which they left on your pillow. The hotel is ideally situated for visiting the centre of the city especially potsdamer platz. Indeed Berlin on the whole was a fantastic city to get around on with its interlinking trains which are very easy to use and very safe (we were also given a wondeful rendition of 13 by Johnny Cash while on the U-Bahn one day. Very interesting.) There is a lot to see and do round about the hotel and the sheer weight of history is at times quite breathtaking. We regularly used the gym and by the end of the week my girlfriend was also a regular in the sauna. The restaurant serves excellent food and the bar is also very friendly. If there was one criticism (and it would be a small one) the restaurant did at times feel too large and without atmosphere. However the food and service was on the whole wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally enjoyable!!”
Reviews.Author: JoeD_69
Reviews.Content: We booked onto the 'Surprisingly Different" package, and were extremely pleased with the level of service throughout our stay. They even left a small birthday gift and card in the room for a member of our party, even though we hadn't booked the 'birthday' promotion. The staff were friendly and helpful and we enjoyed our nights in the "Anhalter Bar" sampling the varieties of beers and the odd cocktail. The choice at breakfast was varied and set us up for a full day of sightseeing around the city and our meal in the restaurant one evening was wonderful, particularly as we were able to request a change to the set menu without much trouble as one of our party didn't eat meat. The rooms were cleaned to a high standard, as were all areas of the hotel. Location wise, you can easily walk to some of the main attractions with ease and if not, there are buses and the S-Bahn nearby. Overall, we were more than 'surprised' and would certainly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Five points from us!”
Reviews.Author: quiltlover
Reviews.Content: This is a very special hotel! It is a perfect mixture of old and new. We liked the contemporary style of our room and the opening glass roof of the restaurant "Hof Zwei". At one evening we had dinner there and it was great, service as well. We had breakfast, too. The buffet offered plenty to choose from, I loved the Bircher Muesli and all the fresh fruits. The "Anhalter Bar" is very trendy and has so many different cocktails to choose from, that it takes a while to decide... Service at front desk was perfect in a very friedly way. Location is super, just a few steps to the entrance of S 25 Anhalter Bahnhof. I would love to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Overall solid, but not special”
Reviews.Author: DSpot
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights the last weekend of May 2007. The reviews on this site are very much on target, and the property offers a very nice stay, although not perfect. We booked directly on their website, although weren't offered any of the packages mentioned by others on this site. We paid full price for a junior suite, and breakfast was not included. The hip-factor of the hotel is a little overplayed in some reviews -- yes, its a little trendier than most, but certainly not as trendy as lots of other new European hotels. That said, we were pleased with the room (spacious but not large by US standards). We think there was a problem with the A/C which was virtually undetectable even at full blast (and the lowest temperature setting was 21C (~69F), but it certainly didn't cool the room when it was 32C (~89F) outside during the day). Although we would have liked more air circulation (and detected a faint odor at times due to lack of air), we didn't complain because it was easy to open the windows and it didn't bother us much, and we didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel room. The buffet breakfast is pricey (18 Euro) if not included, but everything everyone says it is. We walked most places in the city easily from the hotel, but also used taxis and the S/U-bahn a lot. Location is generally good and where we wanted to be, but I noticed there were several other new properties of apparent equivalent quality that are even better located in Mitte -- next time I'm likely to try one of those.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , good location”
Reviews.Author: Aged_Travellers
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of one of their special offers - 'Surprisingly Different' - this gave us 3 nights bed and breakfast, one evening meal with wine, a 72 hour travel pass and a lunch box on one of the days. We made full use of this package and were able to see much of Berlin using public transport - an S Bahn station is adjacent to the hotel. The Moevenpick is an historic building, which has recently been up-dated and tastefully decorated with all modern facilities. On arrival we were up-graded to a Junior Suite, which gave us a much larger room than we had expected. The bed and pillows were really comfortable and the en-suite bathroom with its glass brick walls allowed a lot of light into the room - a great idea! Everywhere was spotlessly clean. All the staff were extremely friendlly, most helpful and very polite. The Breakfast Buffet offerred a huge choice of both hot and cold food. The evening meal was delicious, as was all the food we ate in the hotel during our stay. We would thoroughly reccommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Silver60s
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a good location close to Potsdamer Platz and visitor attractions such as Checkpoint Charlie. Other attractions are also in comfortable walking distance but there are the alternatives of the S-Bahn and bus stop right outside the hotel, and the U-Bahn at Potsdamer Platz. The 72 hour Welcome Card (available at reception) gives unlimited travel on bus and train and is good value at 24 Euros. The “Surprisingly Different” package includes the 72 hour Welcome Card plus a free evening dinner, free drinks in the bar for two evenings and a free packed lunch. The buffet breakfast is extensive and excellent quality. The hotel has a fresh, modern décor and rooms are good-sized and well laid-out. The modern style extends to the rooms where the bathroom is enclosed by glass bricks, possibly a problem if one was excessively shy !! Overall an enjoyable, good value hotel, well located with excellent services and pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Ludo-News
Reviews.Content: Arrived late (11.30pm) on a Saturday night in February to a very welcoming receptionist who informed us the restaurant was still open! Quickly checked in to a fab room with the glass walls! Had a really good meal, which was so good we came back the next night! Breakfast buffet (we found an inclusive rate with otel.com) was excellent with masses of choice so we stuffed ourselves stupid. Found the sauna which we had all to ourselves. Also found art/sculpture dotted around of bits of machinery which was interesting. The old part stairwell was impressive as well. Located close to the underground, Anhalter Station ( S-Bahn), which is very easy to use, also very easy to walk places in this interesting city. We would definately recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great 3 Night stay”
Reviews.Author: Bantamspaul
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay with my wife at the Moevenpick, Berlin. We stayed in a Junior Suite (via an upgrade at the hotel) on the 'surprisingly different package'. From the moment we arrived we were looked after - the room was very large with a small sofa and two chairs, a glass wall screened bathroom with seperate shower cubicle and a separate room for the toilet. Fittings were excellent and the bed comfy but firm and our inner courtyard facing room was wonderfully quiet at night. Aircon wasn't a problem but can see that the19C minimum may be too warm for some in the Summer. Breakfast buffet was excellent - the fresh fruit particularly and the package allowed us two free drinks each in the bar from 1700 to 1900 as well as an evening meal in the hotel including wine, a packed lunch and two free 3 day passes for buses, U & S Bahn trains & trams. Location right next to Anhalter Station ( S-Bahn) and 10mins wlk from Potsdamer Platz though the immediate location is very quiet at night. Berlin is quite superb and I would recommend both the city and this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: rascalito
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, new and central with very friendly and helpful staff. It's ten minutes walk from Potsdammer Platz and 20 from Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag. The rooms are quite big, very modern and clean. Breakfast is fantastic with a lot of choice. The S-bahn station Anhalter banhoff is less than a minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located great, hotel.”
Reviews.Author: culchiegirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is steeped in history, Its quirky and the staff are more than helpful. We stayed in a deluxe room which cost 134 euro per night (no breakfast) and was excellent value, I wont repeat all the other reviewers comments , I will just thank them for sending us there, The hotel is so close to the underground that when we got off we couldnt find it / We stepped out of the underground station and were so close to the hotel we were looking everywhere but at its sign directly above us. It is within walking distance of checkpoint charlie where food and drink was unbelievably cheap. Berlin is so underrated as a great value for money destination. We will definetely be going back. Ask for directions to schoneberg which has a huge choice of restaurants and is really good value for money. We didnt get to stay long enough but the lovely reception staff made us feel really welcome.( Although they found it hard to believe we had no post codes in rural Ireland.) For sightseeing take the 100 bus as it covers all the same routes as the tour buses at a fraction of the cost. The cafe across from the hotel does great breakfasts too. (Go upstairs for non smokers) Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Hated Moevenpick”
Reviews.Author: ozlock
Reviews.Content: Booked at the Hauptbahnhof--their service was great with the help of an American agent. But this hotel at over USD200 is the most over-priced I've ever been in. The room is the size of a walk in closet. The bathroom has translucent doors. Cleanliness is marginal. The view is terrible. It's Internet service is extremely expensive and my emails to friends were bounced back because they would not accept multiple addressees. The hotel refused to make an adjustment. Although the location is fair, the garage charges are also excessive. After having spent more than a week in Germany, from Nurnberg, Bayreuth, Dresden, Bamberg and Leipzig where we received great and gracious service, this place was the pits. The food is mediocre and expensive in an unattractive room where guests roll their baggage noisily along a walk to the elevator. There is a really cool bar next door but I would have spent a lot of time in it to make up for the deficiencies of this place. Avoid it at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic. Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: BrimstoneAndTreacle
Reviews.Content: Date: March 2007 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, Dromore, N. Ireland We stayed for 3 nights on the 'surprisingly different package' deal at the beginning of March. This is a luxurious hotel (we upgraded to a junior suite) and certainly one of the best we have ever stayed in. The bathroom was to die for, and just like everything else in the hotel, was sparklingly clean, very stylish, and worked perfectly. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gvee
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from Berlin staying at the fabulous Movenpick. We stayed on the first floor with nice views across to the park. The breakfast is fab with so much choice - delicious. During the day the bar is closed and there is no food available but there are great resturants close by. Berlin is interesting - very quiet - hardly anyone around. Even the tourists spots were quiet. The hotels is fresh and welcoming -staff are friendly and courteous, no problems at all. Would recommend the Movenpick.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning and refreshing”
Reviews.Author: GiveMeMORE
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. First of all, the stunning design bowled us over - we didn't want to leave the room. The staff was very friendly and did their best to please us. The hotel is still new, so their bar wasn't open, but their sauna was great. Room service was on the pricey side - two coffees were 11 Euro. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel. Note that the hotel offers great packages on its website - the best way to go. They offer you a choice of pillows - a neck roll, a spelt pillow, a hot water bottle - they encourage you to ask for them and that really made the trip special. Also the location is excellent - right next to the SBahn, 10 minutes from the Reichstag on foot. I can't wait to go back, my husband and I considered the hotel a high point of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely find”
Reviews.Author: Dutyfreeman
Reviews.Content: I decided to surprise my wife with a getaway in Berlin this weekend and after reading the excellent reviews it has attracted on Tripadvisor I decided to book this hotel. I was not disappointed and would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting this wonderful city. I fully endorse the detailed review of the hotel as written by the Tripadvisor member from Uxbridge. I will definately be returning here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This Has To Be The Place To Stay In Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: StealthMoose
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on the 26th January. I booked a double room through ---.com (£86.00 for the night) about a week before my visit. Unfortunately, due to heavy snow, I didn't arrive at the hotel until just before 11:00pm and I left the hotel just after 10:00am the next morning, so I couldn't absorbe everything. This hotel is superb. It is bright, spacious, very modern and hip. I loved the decor, which was fresh and in excellent condition. The hotel room was very spacious, exceptionally clean and very stylish. My room was on the 4th floor. The glass wall dividing the bathroom from the main room (as you can see from my pictures) wasn't a problem. The room had a high ceiling and two twin beds, which could be pushed together. The beds were firm and comfortable. My sleep was peaceful and the room had long blackout curtains covering the windows/door of the French balcony. There was plenty of storage space within this hotel room. The room had a mini-bar (3 EUR for a 330ml Coke) and room service was available. There was a TV with CNN and BBC World available. The TV had pay-per-view with a couple of movie channels and a couple of adult movie channels. WiFi access was available (9 EUR for 2 hours and 22 EUR for 24 hours - both had restrictions on the amount that you could download within that period). The bathroom was of a good size and had a bath with an overhead shower. There was also a hairdryer, plenty of towels and the usual complimentaries. The restaurant was open until midnight. I went down about 11:15pm. The restaurant has lots of seating but there were only a couple of other diners around. There is a large glass roof which looks as though it will open when the weather is better. The food was fantastic - I really enjoyed it! There was a good selection on the menu and the staff didn't seem at all rushed, despite the time going on well past midnight. 3 courses with wine was 48 EUR. I thought this was good value, especially as the quality was so high. Breakfast is continental style, with a full range of meats, cheeses, fruit, cereal and yoghurts etc. You can also get a cooked breakfast - fried in front of you, while you wait, by one of two chefs on hand. No problems getting seated despite the size of this hotel. I think people will enjoy eating here. There was so much to choose from. Staff are friendly and efficient. The hotel is is an excellent location. It has a moderate sized gym and sauna. It also has business facilities. I recommend this hotel. You will not be disappointed. I will be returning to Berlin in a couple of months and this is the place I'll be heading for.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PearlieLupita
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at this hotel and we love it. Clean and modern with a excellent buffet breakfast. The beds are so comfy, like a cloud... the rooms are incredibly clean and my favorite room has the bathtub in the middle of the room! The breakfast is worth getting out of bed for and the staff is friendly. Good choice for anyone who wants to make sure they have a nice hotel to relax in after a long day of shopping and sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Movenpick Berlin in December on the 'Surprisingly Different' package. I shall not repeat the comments that have been made by other reviewers, other than to say that this is an excellent hotel, providing a high standard of service in contemporary and innovative surroundings. The Surprisingly Different package is excellent value for money and is strongly recommended. Well done Movenpick

Reviews.Title: “Superb !”
Reviews.Author: edstraker123
Reviews.Content: We booked the Movenpick having read lots of positive reviews on Trip advisor and can only say we were absolutely delighted. We stayed in a deluxe room which cost €114 per room per night including the buffet breakfast for the two of us - an absolute bargain. The room was spotlessly clean and extremely modern. The only downside as noted by several people, was the lack of privacy - the bath was in the middle of the bedroom which whilst being very stylish was not very functional and better use could have been made of the space in the room. The Hotel staff were extremely friendly and courteous as you would expect in a German Hotel. We dined in the Restaurant 3 times and whilst the menu does not offer the largest selection of meals, those we had were first rate. Having ordered my steak very well done it arrived cooked to perfection (not oozing blood as is the norm) no mean feat for a piece of meat so thick ! We also frequented the Hotel bar each night rather than going into Berlin itself and quite enjoyed the laid back atmosphere on weekdays as well as the piano entertainment on the Friday night. We couldn't believe it when we were given our drinks for free when we had waited 10 minutes for them on a very busy Saturday night especially as they are brought to your table rather than waiting to be served at the bar. The location of the hotel is fine - it is situated in a quiet area of Berlin but there is a railway station a minute away and Potsdamer Platz is about a ten minute walk so it is extremely easy to get anywhere in the city. We used the U-Bahn frequently and were overjoyed to see that we could change the language on the ticket machines to English which saved a lot of confusion. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Movenpick, Berlin Christmas.”
Reviews.Author: rudisuzie
Reviews.Content: Guten Tag we are just back from another wonderful stay in the Movenpick, Berlin, and have to say that this is a great hotel. We booked the "Surprisingly different" package , to which we added a few days. The staff were very friendly and helpful, as last time we stayed. In fact, some of the staff even knew that we had stayed there in the summer. The room was of a very good size, and also the bathroom. Perhaps some people would want much bigger, but we spent most of our time not in the room, but out and about in Berlin. Perhaps the room was a little cold when you come out of the shower, but we found the room very comfortable, especially as it was so cold outside. The hotel is in a great location, with the S-Bahn and bus stop right outside the hotel, and the U-Bahn just down the road, perhaps a 3-4 minute walk. For getting around Berlin, this is a good location for staying in. Be warned, it did feel a little cold when going down for breakfast, but perhaps we felt this more after just coming out of a really snug bed! Also the packed lunch that you get with the package is huge, it comes in a large bag, and is perhaps too large to carry around Berlin on a cold winters day. So we actually left some of it in our room to eat later! We can not believe that a week has passed by so quickly, but Christmas in Berlin is fantastic. This is one of the best cities in the world to visit. Frohes Neues Jahr.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Lexicles
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Movenpick for a few days in November. The good points were the hotel style, the restaurant food, large rooms with big windows that open, and excellent bathroom facilities. We also had good service in the bar when there was some confusion about the cocktails we had ordered, immediately rectified by 'on the house' - something we should hear more often when mistakes are made. Despite booking a twin room we were first showed to a double, and then to a smoking twin when we complained. We had booked a non-smoking room but because of their mistake with the twin/double we were left with no choice but to take a smoking room - not good and the staff weren't particularly helpful. That said, we couldn't tell that it was a smoking room and it was very comfortable. The hotel is well situated near Potsdamer Platz and Berlin is a walkable city. We had a good Italian meal in a restaurant on the main road about 100 yds from the hotel and excellent breakfast every morning in a cafe on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cristina30
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Movenpick. The rooms were modern & very clean, and the bathroom was really cool! It's very close to Potsdamer Platz (7-10 min.walking) and in 'the middle' of west & east Berlin. The standard rooms are on the small size but very adequate for a few nights. The only negative i can find is that although the bathroom was very nice and special with the 'glass wall', somehow you can't have total privacy in the bathroom. Overall it was a great hotel and i would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, not a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: thebigfella2
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to fault the hotel. It's in a great location, the rooms were clean and had all the mod-cons, the decor very retro. However, the athmosphere was a bit sterile. Perhaps it's just the Germans! All in all though I'd recommend this hotel. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: nxt2mad
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Germany..we absolutely loved this hotel. Awesome accomodations..the bed was superb, modern room (very chic) awesome bathroom, great restaurant and fabulous looking bar with an awesome bartender (Dennis). It was close to the Berlin Wall and walking distance to shops. Staff was friendly and helpful. The room was so awesome i could just stay in bed all day. Breakfast in your room...absolutely devine.

Reviews.Title: “Simply outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: mmarina0664
Reviews.Content: Comfortable beds, delicious food, great location...I loved it. Definitly will consider when will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Room so far”
Reviews.Author: Bannon
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Berlin for a friends 30th Birthday and after reading the reviews on this site, decided to stay at the Movenpick. Whilst not the best location in Berlin (but still pretty good), the hotel itself was fantastic. When booking, we chose an option that would enable us to upgrade our room for a small fee if one was available. Lucky for us there was, and we were upgraded to the best hotel room I have ever stayed in. It had a massive bed, separate toilet, high ceilings, and the walk through bathroom was separated from the bedroom by a huge wall of glass bricks - very impressive. The front staff were very attentive, the breakfast was excellent - if only the weather had been better, as the restaurant has a retractable roof which means you can eat alfresco on a nice day. In terms of nighlife and cafes etc, the location is not the best, but there is a tube stop right outside the hotel. If the weather is good, it is better to walk the 10minutes down to Potzdamer Platz, where there are more lines intersecting allowing you to reach all the other parts of Berlin. I have no hesitation recommending this hotel to anyone visiting Berlin to lap up the history and see the sights as it is easily the best hotel I have stayed at. If you are looking for nightlife and cafes though, you might want to look a bit further north of alexander platz, e.g. senefelderplatz or even hackescher markt - though they are all easily accessible from the Movenpick hotel with a few trains swaps or a pretty cheap taxt ride (about 8 euro).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: seleus
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 3 days here in August. Hotel was outstanding in every way, including the staff who were very helpful. Breakfast was fantastic and set you up for the day. You could walk to most places of interest, but the train system was very good and easy to negotiate. Berlin was a lot better than I expected, very modern with great buildings both old and new, and there was a nice feel to the city. We thought the people of Berlin were very nice and only too willing to help us when we requested assistance. There was a marvellous Italian restaurant at the top of the road which we eat in every night and the food was of a high standard. Would definately go to Berlin again and stay at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JJJR
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several 4 or 5 star hotels in Berlin, and this is our new favorite one. The hotel is in a great location close to Potsdamer Platz. The neighborhood is a bit quieter than many central locations and we felt safe parking the car on the street at night. The hotel itself is, of course, very colorful! This is done in a stylish way that makes you smile in appreciation. I liked the little details like the quotes painted on the walls and the inlaid flower designs in the hall carpets. The staff was always very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was excellent, especially that Mövenpick yogurt and marmelade. We had a familly room with an extra bed for our little boy. There was a lot of space there with a very high ceiling. The bathroom was certainly large enough and stylish like the rest of the hotel. The air conditioning issue was a bit annoying, even in early October, as it didn't work so well and things got stuffy. We tried opening the window -- our window faced the inner courtyard, which is generally the quieter place to be -- but then we could hear breakfast being set-up downstairs through the courtyard's glass ceiling at 3:30 a.m. There was no pool, but there's a great-looking swim complex a street away. We didn't get there but would have liked to. There was just so much else to do! So definitely stay here at this lovely hotel, at least from mid-October till it gets warm in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: moonbather
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Berlin to see the Scorpions in concert and stayed for two nights at this hotel. Our room was very spacious and decorated in a very contemporary style. The bathroom in our room was huge but unfortunately we only had a bath (which was also enormous) but no shower which was a shame. Our friends' room was much smaller than ours as was the bathroom and they had a lovely shower but no bath. If you have a real preference it may be worth checking this out at time of booking as I did not read anything which told me about the difference in bathrooms. We used the sauna one day which was very nice and absolutely immaculate. The reception staff were incredibly helpful and friendly, if you want any information about the city i wouldn't hesitate to ask them. You can also buy the day/2day transport passes at reception. We bought them on our last day and ended up not using them and the nice man at reception refunded our money! We ate at the restaurant on the first night not something we had planned to do but the heavens had opened so we decided to stay put. The meal we had was truly delicious and very reasonably priced for hotel food. Our room price included breakfast and as commented by previous reviewers the breakfast is truly wonderful we were really spoilt for choice and felt it was the best breakfast we had seen in a european hotel of comparable quality. We had a lovely meal at theitalian restaurant which can be found by turning left out of the hotel and it is situated under the accor suites hotel, past a and pizza were both lovely. We walked miles in Berlin and found it a really interesting city the hotel was perfectly located as we could use both the buses and the underground to get around but could also explore the city on foot. If travelling back to Berlin we wouldn't hesitate in stayig here again and recommend it unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay for a moden hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaggieJ
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in previous reviews, this is a convenient location for sightseeing and a very comfortable base in Berlin. Got the train from Shoenfeld airport, then the underground. Reception are helpful and professional. The duvets and pillows are feather, and they had run out of synthetic on the 1st night, but they helpfully found me some cotton sheets etc. The junior suites have a small 2 seater sofa, a couple of chairs and quite a high ceiling. I don’t think the hotel is really airconditioned though, as the system will only cool it if it goes over 21C at night! Needed to open the window instead to let the cooler air in. This was fine as it was quite quiet as the windows faced into the courtyard over the restaurant. The beds were also really comfortable. There was a mini bar fridge in room, no tea/coffee facilities but I don’t usually expect these in a European hotel. Good spacious bathroom, large bath and separate shower, plenty towels, kept spotless, slightly unstable controls trying to get the temperature right at peak times in the morning. Slightly quirky design with the glass brick wall around the bathroom which is at a slightly raised level above the room - the sofa and chairs are on the other side, sort of facing the loo. If you put the light on in the bathroom at night it of course illuminates the whole room. Lovely breakfast restaurant with glass roof that opens. Lots of choice – coffee brought to the table and self service food, with speciality breads, several types of cereals, yoghurts, fresh fruits, cheeses, smoked salmon, scrambled eggs, well worth having and good value compared to the cost of 4-5* hotel breakfasts in the UK. You didn’t really need lunch after it and could get on with the sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel With A Difference.”
Reviews.Author: imol62
Reviews.Content: Just to re -iterate what has been said before, we found this hotel fantastic, very central for all the tourist areas, wonderful room(junior suite), breakfast was vast such a wide chioce, and im a chef of 25 yrs, couldnt find any faults atall apart from the weather, 3days rain out of the 4 . We stayed 21/08/06 to 24/08/06. I booked this hotel on the strengths of the reviews on this site and was not disappointed. This is the 4th time i have used trip advisor to book hotels in europe, and every one has been great. many thanks. just a mention about Romanos on the way into potsdammer, give it a try, really freindly restaurant cheap prices for food and drink, and an exstensive menu, good value for your euro.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, really different.”
Reviews.Author: GlennTheBaker
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 2-night stay at the Movenpick booked via a Priceline bid of £40 per night. I had read reviews here so sort of knew what to expect but was still taken aback by the uniqueness of the place. It is just REALLY cool! I had emailed ahead to request a king bed and this was granted with no problems. The staff were very polite and helpful. The room was beautiful and as described in other reviews here. Location was great for visiting the Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie and others. I would not hesitate in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: sgm111
Reviews.Content: great hotel, one of the best i have ever stayed in europe! spacious rom, a very nice bathroom, excellent service... highly recommended....

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mherbert
Reviews.Content: This is a very stylish and comfortable hotel conveniently situated very close to the Ahalter Bahnhof S-Bahn stop (although the station itself has vanished apart from the facade). The hotel is in a renovated former Siemens building and is very modern and contemporary both in the foyer and dining room and in the bedrooms. Breakfasts were outstanding with a huge choice of yoghurts, breads, cheeses, fresh fruits and cooked items. The staff were very helpful and spoke English. We went for a walk on our last day and discovered a local supermarket and small cafes and bars nearby as well as a park. Thoroughly recommended and outstanding value..

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Crakma
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading all the reviews and so glad we did. We travelled with 2 boys 11 and 13 and could not fault anything. The rooms were spotless and spacious. The breakfast buffet is still talked about and we also enjoyed a fantastic dinner in the hotel. Great location and all the staff were fantastic and very helpful. Have recommended this hotel to everyone we know. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Pray it's not warm!”
Reviews.Author: Mayfair Ranger
Reviews.Content: Yes, the location is great. Yes, the place is trendy. Our "suite" (for which read large room) was also very spacious, clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast is excellent. But, boy, do they have a real problem with the A/C - just as other summer reviewers have pointed out. My complaint is not that the system only cools to 21 degrees - this would not be an issue in the slightest if, in fact, it were actually capable of cooling to anything approaching this temperature in summer. The simple fact is that it isn't, and this detracted hugely from my enjoyment of the property. To make matters worse, the staff are clearly trained to deny that there is an issue, instead implying that it is unreasonable for guests to expect the system to work any better than it does. Moevenpick management - I suggest you read the sheer volume of comments here and draw your own conclusions. Until you do, this will remain a quirky, interesting, well-located but fundamentally flawed hotel. (P.S. While you're at it, you might consider investing in a gym worthy of the premises - or, if you believe that just one treadmill is sufficient for a large hotel, please at least ensure that it functions!)

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: travelangel_2006
Reviews.Content: The Movenpick Berlin is pretty much in the middle of re-unified Berlin. Most of the main sights are within walking distance and the ones that aren't are easily accessible via the S Bahn opposite the hotel (including a direct link to out-of-town Wannsee and the compelling exhibition in the villa which housed the Wannee Conference in 1942). Don't miss the booklet in the room entitled "A House with a History" - your visit will be the richer for knowing more about the building. It's been lovingly restored only a few years ago into a funky, modern hotel, yet retaining original features and casting more than the occasional nod to Bauhaus. Beds are exceedingly comfy and rooms immiaculate. Surprisingly peaceful,.too - although you'd be well advised to go midweek if you want to guarantee avoiding noisy party goers arriving back in the middle of the night! Yes, the air conditioning appears to be stuck at a minumum of 21 degrees, but this was cool enough in July nonetheless. Bizarrely, no tea/coffee-making facilities in the "deluxe" room - something we missed more than we thought we would.

HotelInfo.Name: Moevenpick Hotel Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Schoneberger Strasse 3 | beim Potsdamer Platz, 10963 Berlin, Germany
